trustee doleen behnke trustee charles kniffen trustee township board ____________ gary r rentrop township attorney preface this a recodification of the general and permanent ordinances of the charter township of oxford michigan source materials used in the preparation of the ordinances adopted by the township board the source of each section is included in the history note appearing in parentheses at the end thereof the absence of such a note indicates that the section is new and was adopted for the first time with the adoption of the use of the comparative tables appearing in the back of this the reader can locate any section of any ordinance included herein the chapters of the been conveniently arranged in alphabetical order and the various sections within each chapter have been catchlined to facilitate usage notes which tie related sections of the have been included a table listing the state law citations and setting forth their location within the included at the back of this system the chapter and section numbering system used in this the same system used in many state and local government codes each section number consists of two parts separated by a dash the figure before the dash refers to the chapter number and the figure after the dash refers to the position of the section within the chapter thus the second section of chapter 1 is numbered 12 and the first section of chapter 6 is 61 under this system each section is identified with its chapter and at the same time new sections can be inserted in their proper place by using the decimal system for amendments for example if new material consisting of one section that would logically come between sections 61 and 62 is desired to be added such new section would be numbered 615 new articles and new divisions may be included in the same way or in the case of articles may be placed at the end of the chapter embracing the subject and in the case of divisions may be placed at the end of the article embracing the subject the next successive number shall be assigned to the new article or division new chapters may be included by using one of the reserved chapter numbers care should be taken that the alphabetical arrangement of chapters is maintained when including new chapters page numbering system the page numbering system used in this a prefix system the letters to the left of the colon are an abbreviation which represents a certain portion of the volume the number to the right of the colon represents the number of the page in that portion in the case of a chapter of the the number to the left of the colon indicates the number of the chapter in the case of an appendix to the the letter immediately to the left of the colon indicates the letter of the appendix the following are typical parts of codes of ordinances which may or may not appear in this this time and their corresponding prefixes code cd code appendix cda1 code comparative tables cct1 state law reference table slt1 code index cdi1 index the index has been prepared with the greatest of care each particular item has been placed under several headings some of which are couched in lay phraseology others in legal terminology and still others in language generally used by local government officials and employees there are numerous cross references within the index itself which stand as guideposts to direct the user to the particular item in which the user is interested looseleaf supplements a special feature of this publication is the looseleaf system of binding and supplemental servicing of the publication with this system the publication will be kept uptodate subsequent amendatory legislation will be properly edited and the affected page or pages will be reprinted these new pages will be distributed to holders of copies of the publication with instructions for the manner of inserting the new pages and deleting the obsolete pages keeping this publication uptodate at all times will depend largely upon the holder of the publication as revised pages are received it will then become the responsibility of the holder to have the amendments inserted according to the attached instructions it is strongly recommended by the publisher that all such amendments be inserted immediately upon receipt to avoid misplacing them and in addition that all deleted pages be saved and filed for historical reference purposes acknowledgments this publication was under the direct supervision of roger d merriam senior connie timmons editor of the municipal tallahassee florida credit is gratefully given to the other members of the publishers staff for their sincere interest and able assistance throughout the project the publisher is most grateful to mr gary r rentrop township attorney for his cooperation and assistance during the progress of the work on this publication it is hoped that his efforts and those of the publisher have resulted in a ordinances which will make the active law of the township readily accessible to all citizens and which will be a valuable tool in the daytoday administration of the townships affairs copyright all editorial enhancements of this michigan ordinance no 119 an ordinance adopting and enacting a new code for the charter township of oxford michigan  providing for the repeal of certain ordinances not included therein  providing a penalty for the violation thereof  providing for the manner of amending such code  and providing when such code and this article shall become effective the charter township of oxford ordains the ordinances oxford charter township michigan published by municipal consisting of chapters 1 each inclusive is adopted repealer all ordinances of a general and permanent nature enacted on or before  and not included in the recognized and continued in force by reference therein are repealed repealed ordinances not revised the repeal provided for in section 2 hereof shall not be construed to revive any ordinance or part thereof that has been repealed by a subsequent ordinance that is repealed by this article penalty unless another penalty is expressly provided every person convicted of a violation of any provision of the any ordinance rule or regulation adopted or issued in pursuance thereof shall be punished by a fine not to exceed $50000 and costs of prosecution or by imprisonment for a period of not more than 90 days or by both such fine and imprisonment except as otherwise provided by law or ordinance as to violations of this are continuous with respect to time each day that the violation continues is a separate offense and as to other violations each violation constitutes a separate offense the penalty provided by this section unless another penalty is expressly provided shall apply to the amendment of any whether or not such penalty is reenacted in the amendatory ordinance in addition to the penalty prescribed above the township may pursue other remedies such as abatement of nuisances injunctive relief and revocation of licenses or permits amendments to or amendments to the passed in such form as to indicate the intention of the township to make the same a part of the be deemed to be incorporated in the so that reference to the the additions and amendments later ordinances ordinances adopted after  that amend or refer to ordinances that have been citation of ordinances embraced in this and the following chapters shall constitute and be designated the ordinances oxford charter township michigan and may be so cited such ordinances may also be cited as the oxford charter township  definitions and rules of construction the following definitions and rules of construction shall apply to this to all ordinances and resolutions unless the context requires otherwise or except as otherwise defined in a particular provision of this an ordinance or resolution generally when provisions conflict the specific shall prevail over the general all provisions shall be liberally construed so that the intent of the township board may be effectuated the provisions of this minimum requirements adopted for the protection of the natural resources and the public health safety and welfare of the township when provisions within this other township ordinances conflict with this the more restrictive requirements or the requirements imposing the higher standard shall control words and phrases shall be construed according to the common and approved usage of the language but technical words technical phrases and words and phrases that have acquired peculiar and appropriate meanings in law shall be construed according to such meanings term  means the ordinances oxford charter township michigan as designated in section 11 computation of time in computing a period of days the first day is excluded and the last day is included if the last day of any period or a fixed or final day is a saturday sunday or legal holiday the period or day is extended to include the next day that is not a saturday sunday or legal holiday conjunctions in a provision involving two or more items conditions provisions or events which items conditions provisions or events are connected by the conjunction and or or eitheror the conjunction shall be interpreted as follows 1 and indicates that all the connected terms conditions provisions or events apply 2 or indicates that the connected terms conditions provisions or events apply singly or in any combination 3 eitheror indicates that the connected terms conditions provisions or events apply singly but not in combination county the term county means oakland county michigan delegation of authority a provision that authorizes or requires a township officer or township employee to perform an act or make a decision authorizes such officer or employee to act or make a decision gender words of one gender include all other genders includes including the terms includes and including are terms of enlargement and not of limitation or exclusive enumeration and the use of the terms does not create a presumption that components not expressed are excluded joint authority a grant of authority to three or more persons as a public body confers the authority on a majority of the number of members as fixed by statute or ordinance may the term may is to be construed as being permissive and not mandatory may not the term may not states a prohibition month the term month means a calendar month number the singular includes the plural and the plural includes the singular oath affirmation sworn affirmed the term oath includes an affirmation in all cases where an affirmation may be substituted for an oath in similar cases the term sworn includes the term affirmed officers departments etc references to officers departments boards commissions or employees are to township officers township departments township boards township commissions and township employees owner the term owner as applied to property includes any part owner joint owner tenant in common tenant in partnership joint tenant or tenant by the entirety of the whole or part of such property with respect to special assessments however the owner shall be considered to be the person whose name appears on the assessment roll for the purpose of giving notice and billing person the term person means any individual partnership corporation association club joint venture estate trust or governmental unit and any other group or combination acting as a unit and the individuals constituting such group or unit personal property the term personal property means any property other than real property planning commission the term planning commission means the planning commission of the charter township of oxford michigan premises the term premises as applied to real property includes land and structures property the term property means real and personal property public acts references to public acts are references to the public acts of michigan for example a reference to public act no 246 of 1945 is a reference to act no 246 of the public acts of michigan of 1945 any reference to a public act whether by act number or by short title is a reference to such act as amended real property real estate land lands the term real property includes land tenements and hereditaments shall the term shall is to be construed as being mandatory sidewalk the term sidewalk means any portion of the street between the curb or the lateral line of the roadway and the adjacent property line intended for the use of pedestrians signature subscription the term signature or subscription includes a mark when the person cannot write state the term state means the state of michigan street highway alley the term street or highway means the entire width subject to an easement for a public rightofway or owned in fee by the township county or state or every way or place of whatever nature whenever any part thereof is open to the use of the public as a matter of right for purposes of public travel the term alley means any such way or place providing a secondary means of ingress and egress to and from property swear the term swear includes affirm tenses the present tense includes the past and future tenses the future tense includes the present tense township the term township means the charter township of oxford michigan or oxford charter township michigan township board the term township board means the township board of oxford charter township michigan water and sewer committee the term water and sewer committee means the oxford township water and sewer committee week the term week means seven consecutive days written the term written includes any representation of words letters symbols or figures year the term year means 12 consecutive months zoning ordinance the term zoning ordinance means the zoning ordinance of the charter township of oxford catchlines of sections appearing in parentheses after sections in this no legal effect and only indicate legislative history editors notes cross references and state law references that appear in this sections or subsections or that otherwise appear in footnote form are provided for the convenience of the user of the have no legal effect c unless specified otherwise all references to chapters or sections are to chapters or sections of this   effect of repeal of ordinances a unless specifically provided otherwise the repeal of a repealing ordinance does not revive any repealed ordinance b the repeal or amendment of an ordinance does not affect any punishment or penalty incurred before the repeal took effect nor does such repeal or amendment affect any suit prosecution or proceeding pending at the time of the amendment or repeal amendments to   effect of new ordinances  amendatory language a all ordinances adopted subsequent to this amend repeal or in any way affect this be numbered in provisions in full in the repealing ordinance supplementation of a supplements to this be prepared and printed whenever authorized or directed by the township a supplement to this include all substantive permanent and general parts of ordinances adopted during the period covered by the supplement and all changes made thereby in this pages of the supplement shall be so numbered that they will fit properly into this will where necessary replace pages that have become obsolete or partially obsolete the new pages shall be so prepared that when they have been inserted this be current date of the adoption of the latest ordinance included in the supplement b in preparing a supplement to this all portions of this have been repealed shall be excluded from this the omission thereof from reprinted pages c when preparing a supplement to this the person authorized to prepare the supplement may make formal nonsubstantive changes in ordinances and parts of ordinances included in the necessary to preserve the original meaning of the ordinances inserted in this   general penalty  continuing violations a in this section the term violation of this  means any of the following 1 doing an act that is prohibited or made or declared unlawful an offense a violation a civil infraction a municipal civil infraction or a misdemeanor by ordinance or by rule or regulation authorized by ordinance 2 failure to perform an act that is required to be performed by ordinance or by rule or regulation authorized by ordinance 3 failure to perform an act if the failure is prohibited or is made or declared unlawful an offense a violation a civil infraction a municipal civil infraction or a misdemeanor by ordinance or by rule or regulation authorized by ordinance b in this section the term violation of this  does not include the failure of a township officer or township employee to perform an official duty unless it is specifically provided that the failure to perform the duty is to be punished as provided in this section c unless declared to be a civil infraction or a municipal civil infraction a violation of this a misdemeanor d except as otherwise provided a person convicted of a violation of this is a misdemeanor shall be punished by a fine not to exceed $50000 and costs of prosecution or by imprisonment for a period of not more than 90 days or by both such fine and imprisonment  provided however that a violation of this punishable by imprisonment for not more than 93 days or a fine of not more than $50000 or both if the violation substantially corresponds to a violation of state law that is a misdemeanor for which the maximum period of imprisonment is 93 days e the following provisions apply to violations of this are municipal civil infractions 1 a person found responsible or responsible with explanation for a municipal civil infraction shall be subject to a civil fine to be determined by the district court having jurisdiction in the township 2 such person shall be subject to costs including all expenses direct and indirect to which the township has been put to enforce such civil infraction in the amount of not less than $900 and not more than $50000 3 if such person refuses to pay such civil fine and costs in a timely manner as set forth under court order the township may obtain a lien against the land building or structure involved in the violation such lien may be obtained enforced and discharged subject to the procedures and limitations in section 87313 of the revised judicature act of 1961 mcl 3 4 the penalties set forth in this section are otherwise controlled by the requirements of michigan law the township may further pursue injunctive or other remedies permitted at law to enforce provisions of this f except as otherwise provided by law or ordinance 1 as to violations of this are continuous with respect to time each day that the violation continues is a separate offense 2 as to other violations each violation constitutes a separate offense g the imposition of a penalty does not prevent suspension or revocation of a license permit or franchise or other administrative sanctions h violations of this are continuous with respect to time are a public nuisance and may be abated by injunctive or other equitable relief the imposition of a penalty does not prevent injunctive relief or civil or quasijudicial enforcement severability if any provision of this its application to any person or circumstances is held invalid or unconstitutional the invalidity or unconstitutionality does not affect other provisions or applications of this can be given effect without the invalid or unconstitutional provision or application and to this end the provisions of this severable provisions deemed continuation of existing ordinances the provisions of this insofar as they are substantially the same as legislation previously adopted by the township relating to the same subject matter shall be construed as restatements and continuations thereof and not as new enactments not affect prior offenses or rights a nothing in this the ordinance adopting this any offense or act committed or done any penalty or forfeiture incurred or any contract or right established before the effective date of this b the adoption of this not authorize any use or the continuation of any use of a structure or premises in violation of any township ordinance on the effective date of this   certain ordinances not affected by in this the ordinance adopting this the validity of any of ordinance or portion of an ordinance enforcement officer for weapons  30272 division 1  generally officer a office established there is hereby established the office of ordinance enforcement officer within the township b appointment and removal  term the township board is hereby authorized by resolution at any regular meeting of the board to appoint any person or persons to the office of ordinance enforcement officer for such term or terms as may be designated in such resolution the board may further by resolution remove any person from such office at the discretion of the board c authority to enforce ordinances the ordinance enforcement officer is hereby authorized to enforce all ordinances of the township whether heretofore or hereafter enacted and whether such ordinances specifically designate a different official to enforce the ordinance or do not designate any particular enforcing officer where a particular officer is so designated in any such ordinance the authority of the ordinance enforcement officer to enforce the ordinance shall be in addition and supplementary to the authority granted to such other specific officer the authority of the ordinance enforcement officer shall also be in addition and supplementary to the authority vested in the township supervisor by state statute the ordinance enforcing authority of the township supervisor and the other officers specifically designated in any township ordinance shall continue in full force and effect and shall in no way be diminished or impaired by the terms of this section d specific enforcement duties the ordinance enforcement duties authorized in this section shall include among others the following investigation of ordinance violations serving notice of violations serving appearance tickets as authorized by public act no 175 of 1927 mcl 7601 et seq appearance in court or other judicial proceedings to assist in the prosecution of ordinance violators and such other ordinanceenforcing duties as may be delegated by the township supervisor or assigned by the township attorney  3121986 secs 262280  reserved division 2  benefits definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning appointed officials include the deputyassistant clerk deputyassistant treasurer assessor and building officialzoning administrator an appointed official may also be considered a fulltime employee pursuant to this division provided the appointed official is scheduled to regularly work 40 hours per week in a calendar year elected official means a person who has been elected to serve in a public office of the township by the qualified electors of the township the term elected officials shall also include an official who has been appointed to serve part or all of the remainder of an elected officials term of office elected officials include the supervisor the clerk the treasurer and the four trustees of the township board for purposes of this division fulltime employee means an employee who is scheduled to regularly work 40 hours per week in a calendar year personnel policy means the personnel policy as amended adopted and in effect for the township temporary employees means employees who occupy positions that are temporary in nature for specific purposes and with expected end dates  12131995 cross reference definitions generally  12 scope and effect of division a this division shall not affect any additional benefits provided for in the personnel policy of a nature not described in this division such benefits provided in the personnel policy shall remain in full force and effect b this division shall not affect any benefits which the township is required to provide pursuant to the laws of the state such benefits shall remain in full force and effect c the authority given under this division is in addition to and not in derogation of any power existing in the township under the laws of the state  12131995 ratification of existing plans the township hereby ratifies and confirms the validity of any annuity or pension plan insurance or prepayment plan arrangement in existence on the effective date of the ordinance from which this division is derived  12131995 retirement system a pursuant to public act no 77 of 1989 mcl b the township board is hereby authorized but not required to create and establish or maintain an existing annuity or pension program for the pensioning of its elected and appointed officials and fulltime employees in addition to the salary or wage of each appointed official and fulltime employee as determined by the township board b for purposes of creating and establishing or maintaining an existing annuity or pension program the township supervisor and the township clerk with approval of the township board are hereby authorized to sign the contract in the name of the township subject to approval by the township board with any company authorized to transact such business within the state for annuities or pensions c the annuity or pension plans created and established under this division or the annuity or pension plans maintained hereafter shall cover elected and appointed officials and each fulltime employee as set forth in the personnel policy d the township may make contributions to the annuity or pension plan created or maintained under this division for each employee according to the terms of the plan created or maintained and amended from time to time and by the personnel policy the following contributions by the township shall be made to an existing annuity or pension plan approved by the township board 1 fifteen percent of an eligible appointed officials or fulltime employees salary or wage 2 ten percent of an elected officials including township board trustees salary or wage this contribution shall be secured from the general fund of the township e the responsibility and method of each employee for the employees individual contributions to the annuity or pension plan and the method for making such contributions shall be governed by the terms of the plan created or maintained and amended from time to time and by the terms of the personnel policy f each employees eligibility to participate in the annuity or pension plan created or maintained pursuant to this division and the vesting of the employees right or interest in the plan shall be governed by the criteria established under the plan as amended from time to time and by the terms of the personnel policy g the responsibility and method of each elected official for the officials individual contributions to the annuity or pension plan and the method for making such contributions shall be governed by the terms of the plan created or maintained and amended from time to time by resolution of the township board h each elected officials eligibility to participate in the annuity or pension plan created or maintained pursuant to this division and the vesting of the officials right or interest in the plan shall be governed by the criteria established under the plan as amended from time to time by resolution of the township board i any appointed official or fulltime employee though eligible to participate in an annuity or pension plan pursuant to this section may decline to participate by giving written notice to the township clerk prior to the commencement of any coverage period if the appointed official or fulltime employee decides to terminate such coverage during a coverage period the coverage will cease according to the terms of the plan  12131995 other benefits a pursuant to public act no 77 of 1989 mcl b the township board is hereby authorized but not required to make arrangements with a prepayment plan or a copayment plan authorized to transact business within the state to insure and cover township elected or appointed officials excluding however the four trustees for purposes of this section and fulltime employees under policies of group insurance or prepayment plan contracts or both covering life accident health hospitalization dental optical medical and surgical service insurance including hospitalization and medical and surgical service and expense for their spouse andor dependents prior to their 19th birthday of the appointed officials and fulltime employees b for the purposes of this section the following classes of persons in the township are eligible for the benefits as set forth in subsection a of this section 1 fulltime employees 2 elected officials 3 appointed officials who are also fulltime employees township board trustees although elected and temporary employees are not eligible for benefits for purposes of this section c employee eligibility for insurance or coverage for fulltime appointed officials and fulltime employees shall be governed by the terms of the personnel policy and the terms of the contract or arrangement as both may be amended from time to time d if the appointed official or fulltime employee decides to terminate such coverage as set forth in subsection a of this section during a coverage period the coverage will cease according to the terms of the plan e fulltime appointed officials and fulltime employees who are eligible to participate in the townships medical insurance plan and also have medical insurance coverage available on another policy can instead opt to accept compensation in lieu of medical insurance fulltime elected officials the supervisor clerk and treasurer are not eligible to receive compensation in lieu of participation in the townships medical insurance plan f any appointed official or fulltime employee though eligible to participate in a group insurance or other plan pursuant to this section may decline to participate by giving written notice to the township clerk prior to the first day of the last month of the end of the townships fiscal year in order for the appointed official or fulltime employee to receive compensation in lieu of participation in the townships medical insurance plan for the immediately succeeding fiscal year g if an appointed official or fulltime employee waives the medical insurance coverage offered the appointed official or fulltime employee has the option to be compensated by an increase in the appointed officials or fulltime employees salary or wage h the compensation received by eligible appointed officials and fulltime employees shall apply to their salary and is not transferable or applicable to a future employees starting wage or salary for a similar position i the eligibility of appointed officials and fulltime employees for compensation in lieu of medical insurance or coverage shall be governed by terms as set forth in a resolution adopted by the township board j if an appointed official or fulltime employee who is currently receiving compensation in lieu of medical insurance or coverage elects to be included in the townships group insurance or other plan pursuant to this section he shall be monetarily compensated until he receives insurance or coverage proportionately for the months in which he elected to accept compensation in lieu of insurance or coverage this compensation shall be paid in a lump sum total to the appointed official or fulltime employee on the final scheduled working day of the townships fiscal year k an appointed official or fulltime employee may elect to be included in the townships medical insurance plan at any time reinstatement shall occur only one time for any appointed official or fulltime employee in any particular fiscal year of the township the township board may permit more than one reinstatement in any fiscal year if warranted by extenuating circumstances l if an appointed official or fulltime employee is currently accepting compensation in lieu of participation in the townships medical insurance coverage plan and elects to be included in the townships medical insurance coverage plan the effective date of coverage shall be governed by the terms of the existing medical insurance coverage plan in effect for the township  12131995 appendix a appendix b appendix c secs 2862110  reserved article iv  finance footnotes  3  cross reference any ordinance promising or guaranteeing the payment of money or authorizing the issuance of bonds or other instruments of indebtedness saved from repeal  1113  taxation ch 50 recovery of expenses of emergency responses to incidents involving motor vehicles and alcohol or drugs a purpose the township finds that a significant number of traffic arrests and traffic accidents in the township involve drivers who are operating a motor vehicle while under the influence of or impaired by an intoxicating liquor or a controlled substance or a combination thereof or having an unlawful blood alcohol level in addition the township finds that when a traffic accident involves drivers who were operating a motor vehicle while under the influence of or impaired by an intoxicating liquor or controlled substance or a combination thereof or having an unlawful blood alcohol level there is a greater likelihood of personal injury and property damage as a result a greater operational and financial burden is placed upon the townships police firefighting and rescue services by persons who are operating a motor vehicle while under the influence of or impaired by an intoxicating liquor or a controlled substance or a combination thereof or having an unlawful blood alcohol level b definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this section shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this subsection except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning emergency response means 1 the providing sending or dispatch of police firefighting emergency medical or rescue services by personnel employed by andor acting on behalf of the township at an accident involving a motor vehicle or vehicles where one or more of the drivers of such vehicle or vehicles was operating a motor vehicle while under the influence of or impaired by intoxicating liquor or a controlled substance or a combination thereof or having an unlawful blood alcohol level 2 the making of a traffic stop and arrest by a law enforcement officer where a driver was operating a motor vehicle while under the influence of or impaired by intoxicating liquor or a controlled substance or a combination thereof or having an unlawful blood alcohol level expense of an emergency response means the direct and reasonable costs incurred by the township a public entity under contract with the township an intergovernmental entity of which the township is a part or a private person authority or corporation operating at the request or direction of the township when making an emergency response including the costs of providing police firefighting and rescue services at the scene of the emergency response these costs further include all of the salaries and wages of the personnel responding all salaries and wages of the personnel engaged in investigation supervision and report preparation all costs connected with the administration and provision of all chemical tests of his or her blood breath or urine and all costs related to any prosecution of the person causing the incident c liability for expense of emergency response 1 responsible person any person is liable for the expense of an emergency response if while under the influence of or impaired by an intoxicating liquor or a controlled substance or the combined influence of an intoxicating liquor and a controlled substance or having an unlawful blood alcohol level such persons operating of a motor vehicle proximately causes an emergency response and that person is determined to be guilty of any of such drunk driving offenses in a district court proceeding associated with the emergency response 2 charge against person the expense of an emergency response shall be a charge against the person liable for the expenses under this section the charge constitutes a debt of that person and is collectible by the township for incurring those costs in the same manner as in the case of an obligation under a contract express or implied additionally the district court is authorized to collect such debt for the township and may charge a service fee for such collection in an amount mutually agreed upon by the court and the township 3 cost recovery schedule the township shall by resolution adopt a schedule of the costs to be charged and included within the expense of an emergency response this schedule shall be available to the public from either the township clerk or the county sheriffs department 4 billing the township clerk or his or her designee may within 30 days of receiving the itemized costs or any part thereof incurred by the township for emergency response submit a bill for these costs by first class mail or personal service to the person liable for the expenses as enumerated under this section the bills shall require full payment in 30 days from the date of service the 30day period shall begin two days after the bill is postmarked 5 failure to pay bill  procedure to recover costs any person described in this section as liable for the expense of an emergency response failing to pay the bill within 30 days of service shall be considered to be in default the 30day period shall begin two days after service is postmarked the failure to pay may further be considered a violation of probation if the payment was ordered by the court at the time of sentencing the township may commence civil suit to recover the expenses attorneys fees and all costs allowed by law arts 13 12132000 appendix a secs 21122140  reserved article v  access to public records definitions the following words terms and and the official acts of those who represent them as public officials and public employees consistent with the freedom of information act mcl  et seq a  1 11101999 submission of request for record a person desiring to inspect or receive a copy of a public record pursuant to the foia mcl  et seq may make a written request for the public record a written request means a writing that asks for information and includes a writing transmitted by facsimile electronic mail or other electronic means such requests shall be directed to the township clerk who as the designated foia coordinator is responsible for accepting and processing requests for the townships public records a written request sent by facsimile electronic mail or other electronic transmission is not considered to be received by the township clerk until one business day after the electronic transmission is made if the township clerk is unavailable the request shall be submitted to the township deputy clerk or other person designated to receive such requests by the township clerk a  2 11101999 processing of request for record upon receipt of a request to inspect or receive a copy of a public record pursuant to the foia mcl  et seq a township official or employee shall promptly deliver the request to the township clerk deputy clerk or other person designated to receive such request by the township clerk together with a written memorandum setting forth a brief summary of the request and the date of the request a  3 11101999 response to request for record within five business days of the day upon which a request is received under section 2144 unless otherwise agreed to in writing by the person making the request the township shall respond to the request by one of the following 1 grant the request 2 issue a written notice to the requesting person denying the request 3 grant the request in part and issue a written notice denying the request in part 4 under unusual circumstances issue a notice extending for not more than ten business days the period during which the township shall respond to the request such a notice shall set forth the reasons for the extension and the date by which the township shall respond in one of the ways specified in subsections 1 3 of this section a  4 11101999 notice of denial of request for record a written notice denying a request under this division in whole or in part shall contain 1 an explanation of the basis under the foia mcl  et seq or other statute for the determination that the public record or the portion thereof is exempt from disclosure if that is the reason for denying the request or a portion thereof 2 a certificate that the public record does not exist under the name given by the requestor or by another name reasonably known to the township if that is the reason for denying the request or a portion thereof 3 a description of a public record or information on a public record which is separated or deleted because of its exempt status under the foia mcl  et seq 4 an explanation of a requesting persons right to do either of the following a submit to the township supervisor a written appeal of the denial that identifies the reason why the denial should be reversed b commence an action in the county circuit court to compel the townships disclosure of the public records within 180 days after the townships final determination to deny a request 5 notice of the requesting persons right to receive attorneys fees and damages if after judicial review the circuit court determines that the township has not complied with the foia and orders disclosure of all or a portion of a public record a  5 11101999 rights of requesting person on denial of request for record if the township makes a determination to deny all or a portion of a request under this division the requesting person may do one of the following at his or her option 1 submit to the township supervisor a written appeal that specifically states the word appeal and identifies the reason or reasons for reversal of the denial 2 commence an action in the county circuit court to compel the townships disclosure of the public records within 180 days after the townships final determination to deny a request a  6 11101999 response to appeal of denial of request for record within ten days after receiving a written appeal pursuant to section 2147 the township supervisor shall do one of the following 1 reverse the disclosure denial 2 issue a written notice to the requesting person upholding the disclosure denial 3 reverse the disclosure denial in part and issue a written notice to the requesting person upholding the disclosure denial in part 4 under unusual circumstances issue a notice extending for not more than ten business days the period during which the township supervisor shall respond to the written appeal the township supervisor shall not issue more than one notice of extension for a particular written appeal a  7 11101999 duties of township clerk  protection of records the township clerk as the foia coordinator is responsible for approving or denying requests made pursuant to the foia mcl  et seq and shall sign all written notices of denial the township clerk shall keep a copy of all written requests for public records on file for no less than one year the township shall protect public records from loss unauthorized alteration mutilation or destruction a  8 11101999 fee a the township may charge a fee for the production of documents pursuant to a foia mcl  et seq request including the costs of searching for a public record copying the record and providing the record or the township may search for andor furnish such documents without charge or at a reduced charge if the township determines that a waiver or reduction is in the public interest the township shall search for andor furnish public records without charge for the first $2000 of the fee for each request to an individual who submits an affidavit stating that the individual is then receiving public assistance or if not receiving public assistance stating facts showing inability to pay the cost because of indigence provided the individual is entitled to information under the foia fees shall otherwise not be dependent upon the identity of an individual making a request b the fee if any shall be calculated to include the following charges in accordance with the following method and policy 1 actual mailing costs 2 actual duplication costs using the most economical means available 3 actual labor costs which shall be calculated based on the hourly wage of the lowest paid employee of the township capable of retrieving the information necessary to comply with the foia mcl  et seq request and these labor costs shall include time spent for search examination review deletion and separation of exempt from nonexempt information duplication and mailing upon receipt of a foia request the township clerk or designee as acting foia coordinator shall make a determination as to which township employee is capable of conducting the search examination review and deletion and separation of exempt from nonexempt information referred to in this section as foia processing the foia coordinator shall select the lowest paid capable employee to conduct foia processing when selecting a capable employee with the lowest hourly wage a determination of the lowest hourly wage shall include the employees salary plus the townships cost of fringe benefits provided to that employee the foia applicant shall then be charged for the time necessary for the employee to conduct the foia processing based on the employees hourly wage plus the actual cost of duplicating and mailing the requested documents 4 if foia processing takes no longer than onehalf hour there shall be no charge for processing costs although duplication copying and mailing costs shall be determined and be assessed to the foia applicant for the purpose of this subsections the township board of trustees has determined that a response to a foia request requiring time in excess of onehalf hour represents an unreasonably high cost to the township unless the township is able to be reimbursed for its processing costs 5 these costs shall be calculated for each separate request so that each individual pays the actual costs of providing to the individual the requested information c if the foia coordinator upon receipt of the foia mcl  et seq request estimates that the total cost of responding to the foia request will exceed $5000 the foia coordinator may request a deposit from the applicant equal to onehalf the estimated cost of responding to the foia request if a deposit is requested pursuant to this section the township need not commence a response to the foia request until the deposit has been paid d the township shall provide each foia mcl  et seq applicant a statement of the bill which categorizes the costs to the township as to mailing duplication and labor costs e once a foia request has been fully processed and documents prepared and the total costs of the foia response have been determined the township shall not release the requested documents to the foia applicant until the total costs of the foia response have been paid the foia coordinator shall treat each foia request as a separate request and the foia coordinator shall not decline to respond to an applicants new foia request based upon the applicants failure to pay the costs associated with a prior distinct foia request by the same applicant a  912 11101999  arts iiii 892000 alcoholic liquor if any officer manager or director thereof or a stock owner or stockholders owning in the aggregate more than five percent of the stock of such corporation would not be eligible to receive a license under this article for any reason e to a limited liability company if any manager or member would not be eligible to receive a license under this article for any reason f to a person whose proposed licensed establishment is or will be operated at any time by a manager unless such manager would be eligible to receive a license under this article g to a person who has been convicted of a violation of any united states state or local law regulation or rule concerning the manufacture possession or sale of alcoholic liquor or a controlled substance h to a person who has been convicted of a crime punishable by death or imprisonment in excess of one year under the law of the place where convicted  or a crime involving theft dishonesty or false statement including tax evasion regardless of punishment this subsection shall not apply if the conviction was entered by a court that was not governed by the constitution of the united states unless the convicting court provided due process to the applicant i to a person who does not own the proposed licensed premises or who does not have a lease therefore for the full period for which the license is proposed to be issued or to a person proposed licensed premises where there exists a violation of applicable building electrical mechanical plumbing or fire codes applicable zoning laws or regulations or applicable public health regulations or any township ordinance l to a person who is in default of any personal or real property taxes or any other obligation due and payable to the township m for any proposed licensed establishment unless the sale of alcoholic liquor is shown to be incidental and subordinate to other permitted business uses upon the premises including but not limited to food sales motel operations or recreational activities n for a proposed licensed premises where it is determined by a majority of the board that the proposed licensed premises do not or will not reasonably soon after commencement of the operation of the proposed licensed establishment have adequate offstreet parking lighting refuse disposal facilities screening landscaping noise or nuisance control or where a nuisance does or is reasonably likely to exist o to any person who is unable or whom the board reasonably believes to be unable to adequately meet the obligations involved in operating the proposed licensed establishment 2 the board may decline to approve an application for a license based upon any of the following grounds a where the board determines that the proposed location is inappropriate for the area where it is proposed to be located based upon any of the following factors 1 the desirability of establishing a licensed establishment in developed commercial areas in preference to isolated undeveloped areas 2 input from surrounding residents and property owners 3 traffic safety 4 accessibility to the proposed site from abutting roads andor the capability of abutting roads to accommodate the commercial activity 5 distance from public or private schools for minors 6 proximity to an inconsistent zoning classification 7 accessibility from primary roads or state highways 8 any other factors which based upon the complete record before the board reasonably indicate that the approval of the proposed licensed establishment would be inappropriate for the area where it is proposed to be located b when the board determines that at the time of the application process issuance of a new license is not in the interest of the health safety or welfare of the residents of the township c when the board determines based upon the materials submitted by the applicant the boards investigation the reviews conducted pursuant to subsection c andor the public hearing held pursuant to subsection d that the issuance of a license to the applicant would not be in the best interest of the health safety or welfare of the residents of the township based upon any of the following factors 1 the applicants experience in the alcoholliquor business andor any other business that the proposed licensed establishment will be involved in 2 the applicants business reputation 3 the applicants moral character 4 the impact of the proposed licensed establishment on the economic development of the area where it is to be situated and the township as a whole 5 the ability of law enforcement personnel to police the proposed licensed establishment 6 the potential impact of the proposed licensed establishment on law enforcement within the township generally 7 the potential impact of the proposed licensed establishment on the safety within the township 8 if the application is for a license for an existing establishment the history and reputation of that establishment 9 the compatibility of the proposed licensed establishment within the surrounding land use and architecture 10 sewer capacity available for the proposed licensed premises 11 any other factors which iii  unsafe structures footnotes  2  cross reference environment ch 22 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning dangerous building means any building or structure which has any of the following defects or is in any of the following conditions 1 whenever any door aisle passageway stairway or other means of exit does not conform to the approved fire code of the township 2 whenever any portion has been damaged by fire wind flood or any other cause in such a manner that the structural strength or stability is appreciably less than it was before such catastrophe and is less than the minimum requirements of this article or any building code of the township for a new building or similar structure purpose or location 3 whenever any portion or member or appurtenance is likely to fall or to become detached or dislodged or to collapse and thereby injure persons or damage property 4 whenever any portion has settled to such an extent that walls or other structural portions have materially less resistance to winds than is required in the case of new construction by this article or the building code of the township 5 whenever the building or structure or any part because of dilapidation deterioration decay or faulty construction or because of the removal or movement of some portion of the ground necessary for the purpose of supporting such building or portion thereof or for other reason is likely to partially or completely collapse or some portion of the foundation or underpinning is likely to fall or give way 6 whenever for any reason whatsoever the building or structure or any portion is manifestly unsafe for the purpose for which it is used 7 whenever the building or structure has been so damaged by fire wind or flood or has become so dilapidated as to become an attractive nuisance to children who might play therein to their danger or as to afford a harbor for vagrants criminals or immoral persons or as to enable persons to resort thereto for the purpose of committing a nuisance or unlawful or immoral acts 8 whenever a building or structure used or intended to be used for dwelling purposes because of dilapidation decay damage or faulty construction or arrangement or otherwise is unsanitary welfare of those living within 9 whenever any building becomes vacant dilapidated and open at door or window leaving the interior of the building exposed to the elements or accessible to entrance by property on which the building or structure is located f the owner or party in interest in whose name the property appears upon the last local tax assessment records shall be notified of the amount of shall be construed to mean the propensity of the person to serve the public in the licensed area in a fair honest and open manner c a judgment of guilt in a criminal prosecution or a judgment in a civil action shall not be used in and of itself as proof of a persons lack of good moral character it may be used as evidence in the determination and when so used the person shall be notified and phrases when used in this chapter shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning burial rights certificate shall mean a certificate which grants the right of burial in a grave cemetery shall mean a burial ground for earth interments cemetery services shall mean all services offered to the public including grave opening closings and foundation installation cremains shall mean the container and incinerated body of the deceased person grave or grave site shall consist of a single burial space consisting of a land area of approximately four feet wide and ten feet in length sufficient to accommodate one vault  one vault and one cremain  or up to two cremains grave or lot owner shall mean the owners of burial rights such rights are limited to a burial privilege as evidenced by a burial rights certificate the ownership interest created by purchase or transfer of any grave or lot is a personal contract right and not an interest or estate in real property spouses or no more than two persons may be joint owners with rights of survivorship to any burial space immediate family shall mean the spouse parent stepparent grandparent child stepchild grandchild and spouse of the aforementioned of the owners and shall include great to the above where applicable interment shall mean the disposition of the remains of a deceased human by earth interment lot shall mean a cemetery lot shall consist of numbered divisions as shown on the recorded plats sufficient to accommodate up to eight grave sites a typical lot consists of eight graves lot marker refers to any means used by the township to locate and mark corners of the lot management shall mean the person or persons duly designated by the township board for the purpose of managing the cemetery markerheadstone shall mean a marker or headstone is a stone or plaque either flush or above the ground usually used for a single grave site indicating the given andor family names mausoleum shall mean aboveground entombment units for human remainscremains memorial shall mean an object commemorating the remembrance of a person monument shall mean a sculpted and shaped stone extending above the ground inscribed with the family name and usually used to mark multiple grave sites resident shall mean any person who has legal or official ownership individually or jointly with another of any real property which is subject to assessment by the township for ad valorem property taxes trustee shall mean the township board of trustees urn shall mean a concrete or stone container with an open top for planting flowers  1112012 sale of lots or graves a purchase of burial rights residents and nonresidents of the township may purchase burial rights at a cost to be determined from timetotime by resolution appendix a of the township board of trustees all such sales shall be recorded on a burial rights certificate appendix b approved by the township board of trustees which grants a right of burial only and does not convey any other title to the lot or grave sold such form shall be executed by the township clerk b transfer of burial rights burial rights may be transferred a transfer of burial rights must be endorsed by and filed with the township clerk upon such transfer the clerk shall issue a new burial rights certificate appendix b to the assignee and shall cancel the original burial rights certificate appendix b thus issued c methods of payment grave sites may be paid in full at the time of purchase or paid on an installment basis payment shall be made by a method as determined from timetotime by resolution of the township board of trustees if graves are purchased on an installment basis ownership of said burial rights will not vest until the entire cost has been paid and no burial may take place on any grave that is not paid in full d contract purchases graves purchased on an installment basis will be evidenced by a contract form furnished by the township with the following stipulations 1 one grave site will require 25 percent of the cost thereof to be paid at the time of the execution of the contract and the balance shall be paid within one year from the date thereof 2 two grave sites will require 50 percent of the cost thereof to be paid at the time of the execution of the contract and the balance shall be paid within one year from the date thereof 3 three grave sites will require 50 percent of the cost thereof to be paid at the time of the execution of the contract and the balance shall be paid in full within two years from the date thereof 4 all other multiple grave site purchases will require a down payment of 25 percent of the cost thereof at the time of execution of the contract and the balance must be paid in full within three years from the date thereof any grave site which has not been paid in full within the time hereinbefore provided shall automatically revert to the township and any sums so paid thereon shall be returned to the purchaser of said burial rights less any administrative charge as set by resolution appendix a of the township board of trustees payable to the township  1112012 purchase price a fees the township board of trustees shall establish the fee for the purchase of a grave these fees may be revised from timetotime by the cemetery and to preserve the aesthetic value thereof in the event that a marker memorial or monument must be removed rebuilt or remodeled the township will not be responsible for any loss thereof either to the lot owner or dealer b townships liability the township assumes no responsibility for assuring that ordered markers memorials or monuments are proper for the area and for name placement on the marker c monument companies liable for damage monument companies are responsible for all damage to cemetery grounds and surrounding markers memorials or monuments that occurs during the installation of a marker memorial or monument d markers and memorials regulations only one marker or memorial shall be permitted per grave with the exception of 1 the placement of a veterans marker which must be placed even with the existing ground elevation  2 two markers will be allowed in the event there are two cremains burials in one grave site provided at least one of the markers is a flat marker placed even with the existing ground elevation e monument regulations no monument will be allowed on any single grave site all monuments must face the east or west direction the township board of trustees must approve any variations in size andor location including the height and weight to prevent the monument from toppling over f foundations the foundation upon which any marker memorial or monument must be placed shall be constructed by such individual as designated by the township board of trustees per specifications from the clerks office and shall be billed by the township to the grave owner or the deceased members family at the rate set by resolution appendix a by the township board of trustees orders for foundations shall be placed a minimum of 30 days in advance of delivery of the markermemorial or monument foundations shall not be poured during the winter months nor for a period of 60 days from the date of the burial to allow sufficient time for the ground to settle g payment of foundation fees no marker memorial or monument may be placed upon any foundation for which there is a balance due nor may any marker memorial or monument be placed upon a grave site for which payment has not been made h variances from requirements any variance from the preceding requirements must be approved by the township board of trustees  1112012   interment regulations a appendix c and interment fee must be provided for all interments per act no 368 of the public acts of 1978 and act no 299 of the public acts of 1980 d method of ordering grave opening the township shall not assume responsibility for errors in opening graves when orders are given by any means of communication other than in writing orders submitted by funeral directors for the opening of graves will be considered as if coming from the lot or grave owner e removal of flowers and emblems following an interment all flowers or emblems used at the interment that have become unsightly shall be removed and the township assumes no responsibility for their return to the owners f interments on saturdays sundays and holidays interments taking place on saturdays sundays or holidays will be subject to a higher fee as set by resolution appendix a of the township board of trustees  1112012 ground maintenance a unauthorized groundwork no grading leveling or excavating upon a grave shall be allowed without the permission of the township clerk or designees b plantings the township board of trustees reserves the right to direct the planting of trees and shrubs in the cemetery all requests must be submitted to the township clerk in writing c board authority regarding plantings the township board of trustees reserves the right to direct the removal or trimming of any tree plant or shrub or other plantings located within the cemetery in the interest of maintaining proper appearance and the use of the cemetery the township has the discretionary authority to trim andor remove all trees shrubs and plantings which have become unsightly or overgrown and encroaching on an adjacent grave no unauthorized trimming pruning or removing of a branch from any tree or shrub in the cemetery is permitted except under the supervision of the township or their designees d mounds are prohibited mounds which hinder the free use of a lawn mower or other gardening apparatus are prohibited e maintenance authority the township or its designee shall have the right and authority to remove and dispose of any and all growth emblems displays or containers therefore that deterioration damage or otherwise become unsightly a source of litter or a maintenance problem f required surface surfaces other than earth grass seed hydro seed or sod are prohibited g proper disposal of refuse with the exception of dirt or soil all refuse of any kind or nature including among others dried flowers wreaths papers and flower containers must be removed or deposited in containers located within the cemetery h urn regulations an urn must be set in line with the marker memorial or monument i location of flower beds flower beds must be located directly in front of and adjacent to the marker memorial or monument j artificial flowers wreaths and grave blankets the township or its designee shall remove all artificial flowers wreaths and grave blankets remaining on the grave after april 1 of each year k items not permitted the following items shall not be permitted chairs settees benches hanging baskets glass containers glasscovered boxes photos and boxes for the preservation of flowers statues ornaments and flower pots other questionable items are subject to the discretion of the township board of trustees  1112012 forfeiture of vacant cemetery lots or graves burial rights for emergency services footnotes  1  cross reference businesses ch 14  fire prevention and protection ch 26 article i  in general secs 1811830  reserved article ii  alarm systems division 1  generally definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning alarm system means a detection device or an assembly of equipment and devices arranged to signal the presence of a hazard requiring urgent attention and to which police fire or ems personnel are expected to respond an alarm system is designed for use for one or any combination of the following 1 the detection of an unlawful entry or attempted unlawful act within a building structure or facility 2 the detection of fire smoke or heat within a building structure or facility 3 the detection of an injury or event to a person within a building structure or facility alarm system user means any owner or occupant who has physical control over the premises where an alarm system is installed within the township except for alarm systems on motor vehicles however if an alarm system on a motor vehicle is connected to an alarm system at any premises the person using such system is an alarm system user excluded from this definition and coverage of this section are persons who use selfcontained alarm systems ie a system which signals or alerts authorized persons who are on the premises of an authorized intrusion attempted robbery or fire condition however if such a system employs an audible signal emitting sounds a flashing light or a beacon designed to signal persons outside the premises such systems shall be within the definition of an alarm system and shall be subject to this article authority means the oxford public fire and ems commission opfec under the provisions of public act no 57 of 1988 mcl  et seq false alarm means the activation of an alarm system failure malfunction improper installation or the negligence of the owner or user of an alarm system or the negligence of the occupant of the residence andor building in which the alarm system is located or of their employees or agents the term false alarm also means any activation of an alarm system which indicates a crime or situation other than that which it was designed to indicate or in the case of a fire alarm any alarm condition not resulting from a fire or potential fire condition  8101994 cross reference definitions generally  12 licensing of alarm businesses a person shall not engage in the business of providing for the installation operating andor maintenance of alarm systems unless properly licensed by the state pursuant to public act no 330 of 1968 mcl  et seq  8101994 automatic dialing systems prohibited a person shall not sell install operate adjust arrange for or contract to provide a device which upon activation either mechanically electronically or by any other means initiates the automatic calling or dialing of or makes a connection directly to a telephone assigned to the police department the fire department a township department the ems agency or the authority for the purpose of delivering a prerecorded message  8101994 separate alarm required for each unit of occupancy in multipleoccupancy buildings separate alarm systems are required whenever a single building contains more than one unit of occupancy and each unit has a separate entrance if such occupant elects to install an alarm system the person shall be required to have a separate alarm system for each such unit located in the building whenever a multiplehousing residential structure shall have separate entrances for each occupancy unit and such occupant elects to have an alarm system each separate entrance to the occupancy unit shall contain a separate alarm system  8101994 duration of audible and visual alarms a no person shall operate install or direct the installation of any alarm system that emits an audible andor visual signal for a period longer than 15 minutes from the initial signaling of the device b an owner or lessee of an alarm system shall within 180 days from the effective date bring presently installed alarm systems and alarm systems offered for sale into conformance with this subsection c whenever any alarm system continues to emit audible signals whether continuously or on a regularly repeating basis for over 30 minutes and the person contacted by the authority does not respond within 30 minutes of being contacted and the audible signals create a nuisance or other disturbance of the peace and tranquility of the neighborhood the alarm user responsible for such alarm shall be guilty of a misdemeanor in addition the authority shall be authorized to disconnect or otherwise disable the alarm system by cutting the wires disconnecting the speakers or disabling other components of the alarm system that are located on the exterior of the premises d the provisions of this section do not apply to fireems alarms  8101994 false alarms a fee imposed  purpose notwithstanding any penalties provided for conviction for any violation of this and land improvement control footnotes  3  editors note a adopted  repealed art iii and enacted a new article as set out herein the former art iii  22612269 and 229122103 pertained to similar subject matter and derived from iixxiv adopted aug 9 2000 cross reference utilities ch 62 short title this article shall be known and may be cited as the charter township of oxford stormwater management and land improvement control  a  i 5122004 purpose the purpose of this article shall be 1 to assure that landowners control stormwater runoff from their property so that lake and stream water quality is protected and flooding reduced 2 to protect the townships lakes from any adverse effects of stormwater runoff while at the same time utilizing the water holding capacity of the lakes 3 to encourage the use of stormwater conveyance and detention systems which serve multiple purposes including but not limited to flood control water quality enhancement recreation and wetlands protection 4 to provide an opportunity for stormwater management and land balancing systems to be incorporated into the early stages of site planning and design 5 to allow onsite andor offsite wetlands to be used for stormwater detention provided that adverse environmental impacts on wetlands are minimized and provided that any anticipated effects are acceptable to the township andor other entities responsible for regulating wetlands 6 to allow for offsite stormwater management if proposals meet the requirements of this article and applicable county andor state requirements 7 to assure that all stormwater conveyance and detention measures and facilities will be properly constructed maintained and preserved 8 to provide penalties for violation of the provisions of this article a  ii 5122004 definition specifications in accordance with the following general standards 1 stormwater management conveyance storage and infiltration facilities shall be designed to prevent flood hazards and water pollution related to runoff from the proposed development project 2 stormwater from upstream and offsite locations shall be conveyed site or stored onsite 3 unless otherwise approved stormwater runoff shall be conveyed vegetated buffer strips so as to decrease runoff velocity allow for natural infiltration allow suspended sediment to settle and to remove pollutants 4 alterations to natural drainage patterns straightened stabilized or otherwise altered without approval from the state department of environmental quality andor the township in accordance with the provision of article iv of this chapter or if the watercourse is a designated county drain approval from the county drain commissioner shall be obtained 6 no modifications of watercourses shall be permitted if the primary purpose is to increase the flow capacity of the watercourse except for the widening of county drains by the office of the county drain commissioner 7 discharge of runoff from commercial and industrial sites which may contain oil grease toxic chemicals or other polluting materials shall be prohibited unless measures to reduce and trap pollutants meet the requirements of the state department of environmental quality and the township 8 drainage systems shall be designed to protect public health and safety and to be visually attractive 9 no land improvement permit shall be granted if the proposed action is likely to impact a wetland or watercourse unless a permit has been obtained pursuant to article iv of this chapter wetland and watercourses may be utilized for stormwater discharge associated with a land improvement provided the discharge conforms with this article and any necessary permits are obtained pursuant to article iv a  xviii 5122004 stormwater detention and retention basin standards a the result in practical difficulties or unnecessary hardship a waiver from the terms of this article shall not be granted by the planning commission unless and until 1 a written application for a waiver is submitted demonstrating that literal enforcement of the article will result in either practical difficulties or unnecessary hardship a the existence of practical difficulties shall be determined upon consideration of the following factors 1 strict compliance with the terms of the article will unreasonably prevent the owner from using the property for a permitted purpose or will render article conformity unnecessarily burdensome  2 the waiver will do substantial justice to the applicant as well as to other property owners  3 a lesser waiver than requested will not give substantial relief to the applicant and will not be more consistent with justice to other property owners  4 the need for the waiver is due to the unique circumstances peculiar to the property and not generally applicable in the area or to other properties  5 the problem and resulting need for the waiver has not been selfcreated by the applicant andor the applicants predecessors  b unnecessary hardship shall be established by demonstrating that 1 the property cannot reasonably be used in compliance with this article  and 2 the need for the waiver is due to the unique circumstances peculiar to the property and not generally applicable in the area or to other properties  and 3 the requested waiver will not adversely affect surrounding properties  and 4 the hardship was not unreasonably selfcreated by the applicant  2 no incidence of noncompliance with this article by any person or on any property shall be considered grounds for the issuance of a waiver 3 notice of a public hearing on the waiver application shall be given the public hearing shall be held any party may appear in person or by agent or by attorney 4 the planning commission shall make findings of fact based upon competent evidence that the requirements of subsection 1a or b have been met 5 the planning commission shall further make a finding that the reasons set forth in the application justify the granting of a waiver and that the waiver is the minimum waiver that will make possible the reasonable use of the property  6 the planning commission shall further make a finding that the granting of the waiver will be in harmony with the general purpose and intent of this article and will not be injurious to the neighborhood or otherwise detrimental to the public welfare 7 in granting any waiver the planning commission may prescribe appropriate conditions and safeguards in conformity with this article violation of such conditions and safeguards when made a part of the terms under which the waiver is granted shall be deemed a violation of this article and punishable as such conditions imposed shall meet all of the following requirements a be designed to protect natural resources the health safety and welfare of the community and to advance the goals of this article b be related to the valid exercise of the police power and purposes which are affected by the proposed land improvement a  xxii 5122004 telecommunications providers pursuant to act no 48 of the public acts of 200 mcl  et seq as it may be amended from time to time act no telecommunications provider as defined in the act shall be required to pay any fee charge financial requirement or other cost under this article beyond that which is permitted by the act no provision of this article shall be construed in such a manner as to violate the act a  xxiii 5122004 penalties and enforcement a person who violates any provision of this article or any of the terms or conditions of a permit is responsible for a municipal civil
