definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning abandoned well means a well which is no longer used or a well which is in such disrepair that its continued use for the purpose of obtaining potable groundwater is impractical or a well which is a threat to groundwater resources or a well which is or may be a health or safety hazard asbuilt plans means engineering drawings prepared after installation of a water system which shall show a statement by a registered engineer or surveyor certifying this to be asbuilt plans and shall include but not be limited to length of mains supply pipes and services pipes where applicable their locations with respect to property lines joints used and mechanical electrical and structural details for pumps wellhouses and a minimum of two witnesses to hydrants valves and other necessary appurtenances and other parts of the water supply system and be of sufficient detail to comply with standards of the county water resources commissioners ocwrc office and to enable the township engineer to insert the water system changes into the current township hydraulic model base connection charge means that charge by the township for the connection of any premises or structure to the water supply system and is equal to the base fee for one residential equivalent unit times the number of residential equivalent units assigned a premises or structure use as established from time to time by the township board by resolution charges for water supply services and charges mean the amount charged to each premises in the township connected to the system for water supply services which may include those charges as set forth in section 6241a and as may be established from time to time by the township board by resolution in an equitable manner to cover the costs of the water supply service contaminant is a biological chemical physical or radiological component in water that is or may become injurious to public health safety or welfare county means county of oakland michigan county connection charge means a charge by the ocwrc office paid coincident to the payment of the base connection charge at the time of connection to the water system this charge is based upon water line size as well as costs associated with turning water on and off for a premises or structure cross connection means a temporary or permanent connection or arrangement of piping link between a potential source of pollution and a potable water supply a backflow could occur developer means the proprietor of multiple structures or multiple premises and includes proprietors of a subdivision condominium subdivision shopping center office building apartments industrial structures manufactured housing etc engineering standards ordinance means the township engineering design standards ordinance set forth in section 421 of this is subsurface water in a zone of saturation main and water main mean those pipes other than supply pipes and service pipes used for conveying or distributing water premises means that entity of use within a structure consisting of a separate ownership or tenancy and shall also mean that use where no structure exists but to which water supply service is made available to real property including areas of landscape remote meter reader means a water meter placed upon a structure obtaining water from the public water system which collects consumption diagnostic and status data from the water meter and transfers that data to a central database for billing troubleshooting and analyzing residential equivalency unit reu and unit mean that measure of potential water consumption equal to the quantity ordinarily consumed by occupants of a residence by a single family of average size the number of units assigned to any premises or type of premises by the township board is designed to represent the potential water consumption thereof as a multiple of the quantity ordinarily consumed by occupants of a residence by a single family of average size as determined from time to time by the township board by resolution service pipe means a pipe extending from the property line or curb cock or valve into the premises supplied with water state means the state of michigan structure means a building to which water supply service is made available structure requiring potable water is a structure where the use of potable water is needed or intended including those used for human occupancy employment recreation or other purposes requiring the need for the use of potable water supply pipe means a pipe tapped into a main and extending thence to and including the curb cock or valve at the property line township means the charter township of oxford oakland county michigan and where the township has assigned its authority it may include the assignee of the township usage charge means that charge as determined by the township board for the volume of water used by premises and in the case of no usage a minimum charge as established by the township board by resolution water booster station means a facility within the water supply system that is utilized to increase water pressure at certain designated points within the water supply system water district means that portion of township designated by resolution of the township board which is serviced or is to be serviced by the water supply system the establishment of the water district does not constitute a representation that the township will extend the water supply system to this area water supply services means the transportation distribution and sale of water to the premises or structures connected directly or indirectly to the water supply system water supply system water system and system mean collectively all plants wells well houses storage tanks pumps work properties and instrumentalities as they shall from time to time exist which are used or useful in connection with the obtaining of a water supply andor the distribution of water by the township including all extensions enlargements and improvements thereto which are owned and operated by the township directly or with the county a art i 892000  res of 282017 cross reference definitions generally  12 penalties unless stated otherwise in this article violations of this article are a municipal civil infraction a  123 892000  res of 282017 variances to article a the township board may grant a variance from the requirements of this article such a variance from the terms of this article shall not be granted by the township board unless and until 1 an applicant submits a written request to the township water and sewer committee for a variance from the requirements of this article and otherwise demonstrates that compliance with the terms of this article is impracticable and the premises is otherwise serviced by an existing source of water that conforms with the requirements of the county health division andor state department of environmental quality mdeq b the township water and sewer committee shall make an investigation of the written application and may consult with the township engineer and other professionals pursuant to that investigation the water and sewer committee shall make a recommendation to the township board upon a variance request after a public hearing with notice delivered or mailed with proof of mailing retained to the applicant and the owners of property within 300 feet of the subject property c the township water and sewer committee shall make findings of fact based upon competent evidence that the requirements of subsection a1 have been met d the township water and sewer committee shall further make a finding that the reasons set forth in the application justify the granting of a variance e the township water and sewer committee shall further make a finding that the granting of the variance will be in harmony with the general purpose and intent of this article and will not be detrimental to the public welfare f in recommending any variance the township water and sewer committee may prescribe appropriate conditions and safeguards in conformity with this article violation of such conditions and safeguards when made a part of the terms under which the variance is granted by the township board shall be deemed a violation of this article and punishable under applicable provisions of this article conditions imposed shall meet all of the following requirements 1 be designed to protect natural resources the health safety and welfare and the social and economic well being of those who will use the premises under consideration and the community as a whole  2 be related to the valid exercise of the townships powers and purposes which are affected by the premises  3 be necessary to meet the intent and purpose of this water ordinance g any variance granted by the township board pursuant to this section shall only continue as long as a source of water in existence at the time the variance request was granted continues to comply with the standards of the county health division andor mdeq should the source of water not comply the variance shall terminate h the township board shall be the final ruling governmental body pertaining to any and all variance requests including reu assignment factors andor calculations a art xiii 892000    res of 282017 organization and management  disposition of revenue a the operation maintenance and management of the system shall be under the supervision and control of the township board the township may collect revenues for the use of the system the township board may designate another party or other parties including but not limited to the ocwrc office to perform the necessary labor and functions in the daytoday operation andor maintenance of the system as well as to provide for the collection of all revenues for the operation maintenance and improvement of the system the township board shall have the authority to accept such systems as gifts as obtained by contract or otherwise from any person and may assign all or any part of the authority contained in this article or deed or transfer to the county the system or any part thereof b to the extent that the township collects any revenue from the collection of usage charges or base connection charges these revenues shall be received into the township water fund c revenues received into the water fund are hereby pledged for the following purposes 1 first an amount shall be directed if necessary each quarter to an account designated operations and maintenance in a sum sufficient to provide for the payment for the next quarter of all current expenses for administration and operation of the system and such current expenses for the maintenance thereof as may be necessary to preserve the system in good repair and working order 2 once sufficient funds have been directed to the operations and maintenance account to pay the current expenses for administration and operation of the system pursuant to subsection c1 remaining funds shall then be directed if necessary on a quarterly basis to a second account designated indebtedness and bond redemption in a sufficient amount to pay any outstanding general indebtedness andor bond obligations 3 out of the remaining revenues in the water fund there shall be set aside in any quarter after meeting the requirements for the operations and maintenance account and the indebtedness and bond redemption account if necessary all remaining revenues into a third account for the purpose of making improvements enlargements extensions and repairs to the system including but not limited to construction of new well houses elevated storage towers water booster stations property acquisitions etc which account shall be designated improvement account d no disbursements shall be made from the water fund except to the accounts as provided in this section e all monies in the water fund of the system shall be deposited with a bank designated by the township board a art ii 892000  res of 282017 extension of system a extension of or changes in water mains may be initiated by the township board or by petition from property owners the township board may refuse to grant the petition or may grant the petition and may prescribe the terms and conditions upon which the petition will be granted and may require the written acceptance of such terms and conditions by the petitioners the work will be done at the expense of the property owners unless otherwise stipulated by the township board and any and all extensions shall be subject to the provisions of this article plans submitted by a petitioning property owner shall be sufficiently detailed to determine whether the extension of the water system is compatible with the water system master plan as defined by the townships hydraulic model the plans shall conform with the engineering standards ordinance chapter 42 article iv of the oxford charter township ordinances b the water system and all water lines including the supply line and associated appurtenances from the curb cock box upstream in the system are under the exclusive control of the township board and all persons other than authorized agents and employees of the township are forbidden to disturb tap change obstruct access to or interfere with them in any way c any person installing water mains and associated appurtenances at his own expense shall first submit complete plans and specifications prepared signed and sealed by a registered civil engineer for such work to the township engineer for review and approval and upon installation such shall be inspected and approved by the township engineer and required county and state agencies before such water mains and appurtenances are put in operation all construction and extensions of any water main and appurtenances shall conform to the construction standards and guidelines as set forth in the engineering standards ordinance chapter 42 article iv of the oxford charter township ordinances any extension of the water main shall conform with the master plan for the water system as prepared by the township engineer and any extension shall be constructed in a manner that will facilitate practicable extension of the water system as determined by the township engineer unless already paid and deposited under the requirements of the township zoning ordinance or other township ordinances a person installing a water main shall deposit into an escrow account an amount sufficient to cover the projected cost of reviewing plans and specifications the escrow amount shall be set forth in appendix a d any person whose property lies outside of an unincorporated portion of the township desiring to connect to the water system will be subject to one 1 times the normal connection fees and one 1 times the normal quarterly billing rate such parties outside the unincorporated township interested in connecting to the water system shall prior to connection obtain a written franchise agreement as required by the state constitution from the governmental body in which the property is located permitting the township to provide water services to the property the proposed connection shall be submitted to the township board for review and a decision within the sole discretion of the township board the owner of the property shall pay into escrow an amount to cover the townships costs for negotiating and reviewing the terms of the franchise agreement with the governmental body in which the property is located e if any new structure occurs within an area for which connection to the water supply system is practicable such structure shall be required to connect to the water supply system the determination of practicability will take into consideration the application of associated costs of connection and location of the structure with respect to the defined water district and this determination shall be the responsibility of the township board  provided however that all new subdivision developments within the water district where such subdivisions including successive phases thereof consist of 15 lots or more as defined by section 46163c shall where capacity exists connect to the water supply system f no premises shall be granted a certificate of occupancy or be allowed to connect to the water system until the township has received and has approved pursuant to review by the township engineer asbuilt construction drawings for that specific portion of the water system that was constructed for the purpose of providing water service to that premises a art iii 892000  res of 282017 service pipes supply pipes and connections a before any connection shall be made to any quality shall where practicable connect to the water supply system at such time as the township board determines the water supply system is available to such structure and the existing well shall be deemed abandoned at such time as the connection to the water system occurs upon connection to the water supply system each private and public water well servicing such premises or structures shall be disconnected and abandoned in accordance with the applicable laws and regulations of the state county and township to prevent contamination of the water supply system i all premises or structures which are on a private or public well shall connect to the water supply system where available at such time as the private or public well is abandoned for that premises of structure the private or public well shall be abandoned in accordance with the standards of the county drain commissioner andor county health division findings the presence of arsenic contaminants in drinking water constitutes a health hazard requiring the filtration and treatment of all such water in order for it to be potable by reason of private water wells sampled in the township in 2006 showing arsenic levels above the maximum concentration levels mcl requirements of the us environmental protection agency and the county the township constructed a water treatment plant the purpose of which was the removal of arsenic contaminants from the water provided by the water system as a matter of public health the owner of a structure requiring potable water shall be required to connect such structure to and obtain water from the water system if the connection is practicable when a new structure is constructed which is not connected to an existing structure which has a potable water supply and in the case of existing structures requiring potable water upon the private well servicing that structure becoming abandoned j upon connection to the water system the water well on the premises used or previously used for obtaining potable water shall be abandoned in accordance with the applicable laws and regulations of the state county and township to prevent contamination of the water supply water supply system shall be established by resolution of the township board and shall be subject to necessary increases or decreases to provide sufficient funds on an equitable basis in order to maintain and operate the system in an efficient manner keep it in good repair contribute to capital costs and to maintain an adequate reserve for improvements and replacements these township rates and charges include 1 base connection charge the charge for connection to the system by a given structure or premises will be determined by multiplying a base fee as established by resolution of the township board by the number of residential equivalent units assigned to the type of use of the premises or structure as also determined by resolution of the township board with the process for that determination being set forth in subsection h of this section 2 usage charge that charge as determined by the township board by resolution for the volume of water used by a premises and in all cases no usage charge shall be less than a minimum charge as established by the township board by resolution 3 escrow fee there shall be required an escrow fee for a sufficient amount to cover the cost of professional services including those of the township engineer utilized for the purpose of reviewing plans and specifications associated with extension of the water system as set forth in appendix a 4 inspection and approval fees those fees identified in section 6242 and appendix a 5 county connection charge in addition the county charges a county connection charge which charge is based upon water line size as well as charges for turning water on and off for a premises or structure 6 debt service charge a charge as determined by the township board by resolution from time to time to assist in bond debt reduction the proceeds of which may be applied as provided for in subsection 6234c b payment of charges for water supply services 1 the use of water from the water supply system at any new construction shall only be permitted upon the payment of required charges identified in subsection a of this section to the township the use of water from the water supply system shall not be permitted and the township shall not accept payment on a connection charge until the basement andor foundation of a new construction has been inspected and approved by the township at such time as the basement andor foundation of a new construction has been inspected and approved the township will accept payment for a connection fee and allow the use of water from the water supply system at the new construction 2 at the time a person or entity obtains final approval of a site plan pursuant to zoning for any new construction requiring a site plan the township will conditionally reserve the required number reus of capacity in the water supply system for that new construction for as long as the site plan for the new construction remains valid and capacity is available for all other construction that does not require a site plan under zoning at the time a person or entity pays for and obtains a building permit for any new construction the township will conditionally reserve the andor foundation of the construction by the township within 90 days of the date the building permit was issued if the person or entity does not obtain said inspection and approval within 90 days the township will have no further obligation to reserve the number of reus of capacity for the construction the person or entity shall pay for such reserved capacity at the water rates at the time of payment as established by the township board 3 change in premise use where a structure consists of multiple premises and there is a change in the use of a premises within a structure which new use connection charge shall be paid for that premise equal to the base connection charge for the new use of the premise less the cumulative base connection charges previously paid for that premises and where there is not a separate meter for the premises and the premises receives its water supply common meter to the structure which structure has multiple premises a new base connection charge shall a precedence in the future g installment and deferred payment for base connection charge 1 an owner of a structure or premises may pay the base connection charge in order to connect to the water supply system by installment payments over a fiveyear period provided the following conditions in the opinion of the township supervisor are met a the structure or premises seeking to connect to the water supply system was in existence prior to the time connection to the water supply system became practicable and was previously served by an independent source of water supply ie water well which has become incapable of serving the structure or premises and the owner of the structure or premises meets the following criteria 1 the structure or premises qualifies as a homestead for the owner as defined under the states general property tax laws at mcl 2111 et seq 2 the owners of the structure or premises has a gross annual income of $3000000 or less 3 the owner has been a resident of michigan for five years or more and a citizen of the united states 3 the owner has owned the structure or premises for five years or more 5 the owner is 65 years old or older or is a totally and to mcl 2117u b the applicable interest rate will be 5 310 percent at the time of connection to the water supply system c an owner of an existing structure who has this home declared as a 100 percent principal residence exemption as determined by the township assessor may pay the base connection charge in order to connect to the water supply system by installment payments over a threeyear period upon the written opinion of the township supervisor the owner will be responsible for paying onethird of the base connection charge upon obtaining a permit to connect to the water supply system the remaining twothirds are to be paid over equal yearly installments over a twoyear subsequent period the applicable interest rate will be five and threetenths percent at the time of obtaining a permit to connect to the water supply system this section does not apply to any new residential commercial or industrial construction 2 in the event the structure or premises qualifies to pay the base connection charge by installment payment as set forth in subsections g1a and b of this section the following shall apply a the structure or premises shall make one installment payment each year in a 1 of each successive year interest shall be charged against the outstanding balance each installment payment shall be applied against the outstanding interest first with the balance applied against principal b each installment payment for the base connection charge shall constitute a lien as of march 1 of each successive year and any installment payment delinquent for six months or more shall be certified annually to the township supervisor who shall enter same upon the next township tax roll against the premises or structure and said unpaid installment payment shall be collected and said lien shall be enforced in the same manner as provided for the collection of taxes assessed upon such roll and the enforcement of the lien thereon such installment payment as shall be delinquent for six months shall be certified annually by the township board to the township supervisor on or before october 1 of each year for failure of the property owner to pay the installment payment on or restriction of water use authorized a whenever the supervisor of the township based upon the recommendation of the township engineer or the county determines the supply or pressure demands for water cannot be accommodated general welfare is likely to be endangered or conditions within the water supply system are likely to endanger the general welfare of inhabitants of the township the supervisor shall with the assistance of the township engineer make such finding and prescribe emergency regulations which shall apply in the township for all properties connected to the township water supply system which may include the following 1 sprinkling of lawns and landscaping and all outdoor water use shall only be allowed for properties with evennumbered addresses on evennumbered dates within a month and for property with oddnumbered addresses on oddnumbered dates within a month 2 sprinkling of lawns and landscaping and all outdoor water use shall not be allowed b the township supervisor shall cause these regulations to be posted at the township offices and other means as may be reasonably calculated to provide notice including the publication of notices in newspapers and broadcast and telecast a art xi 892000  res of 282017 temporary restriction of water use for customers of great lakes water authority a this section shall apply only to those premises receiving water supplied by the great lakes water authority glwa b whenever the supervisor of the township receives notification from the glwa in conjunction with the water and radiological protection division of the state department of environmental quality that the supply or pressure demand for water cannot be accommodated and general welfare is likely to be endangered or conditions within this water system of the township are likely to endanger the general welfare of the township the supervisor shall determine that a state of emergency exists and prescribe the following emergency regulations which shall apply in the township for all properties connected to the township water system glwa water supply sprinkling of lawns and landscaping and all outdoor water use shall only be allowed for properties with evennumbered addresses on evennumbered dates within a month and for properties with oddnumbered addresses on oddnumbered dates within a month c whenever the supervisor receives notification from the glwa in conjunction with the drinking water and radiological protection division of the state department of environmental quality that provisions in subsection b of this section are not sufficient or conditions within this water system of the township are likely to endanger the general welfare of the township the following emergency regulations shall apply in the township for all properties connected to this township water system glwa water supply sprinkling of lawns and landscaping and all outdoor water use shall not be allowed d the township and the glwa shall within 24 hours of notification cause these regulations to be posted at the township office and publicly announced by means of broadcasts or telecasts by the stations with a normal operating range covering the township and may cause such announcement to be further declared in newspapers of general circulation when feasible the regulations shall become effective immediately after notice by the township of enforcement of this section as posted at the township offices upon notification from the glwa in conjunction with the drinking water and radiological protection division of the state department of environmental quality that the emergency regulations are no longer necessary the township shall cause a public announcement to be made lifting the water restrictions e any person convicted of using water in a manner contrary to the provisions of this section or in any other way violating the provisions of this section shall be guilty of a misdemeanor f it shall be the responsibility of the township to enforce this section arts 1 2 491997  res of 282017 cross connection control a adoption of state rules the township adopts by reference as amended from time to time the water supply cross connection control rules of the state department of environmental quality r  of the administrative code b purpose the purpose of this section is to promote and protect the public health safety and welfare by the prevention and elimination of cross connections which have been recognized as the cause of public health problems due to the hazard caused to drinking water quality c administration the ocwrc office operations and maintenance division shall be the designated authority and administrator of the cross connection control program d cross connection control plan pursuant to public act 399 of 197 r  of the administrative code a comprehensive cross connection control plan shall be developed and submitted to the state department of environmental quality division of water supply for review and approval the plan shall outline the conduct of the township cross connection control program including the method for performing initial inspections determining inspectionreinspection frequencies backflow prevention assembly tracking and testing schedules annual reporting generation of compliance noncompliance pertinent piping information requests and water service shutoff notices upon approval by the state department of environmental quality the plan will become an instrument of this section for providing program conduct and policies any changes to the approved plan will be submitted to the state department of environmental quality for review and approval before final approval by the authorityagent the cross connection control plan will be made available to the public for review e designation of agents the authority has the right to appoint a designated agent to administer the cross connection control program and perform inspections in accordance with the approved cross connection control program f inspections the authorityagent shall have the right to enter any facility for the sole purpose of inspecting for cross connections if a facility fails to allow the authorityagent entry the facility shall be deemed to have a cross connection that is an immediate hazard to the public and as such the authorityagent will follow the steps as outlined in the approved cross connection control plan g discontinuance of water service for noncompliance if a facility fails to comply in correcting any deficiencies identified during the cross connection inspection and subsequent reinspection followup inspection and steps as outlined in the approved cross connection control plan the water service to the facility will be discontinued until such time that the deficiencies are corrected and approved by the authorityagent h penalty violations of this section are a misdemeanor in addition at the request of the authorityagent the corporation counsel may bring an action for injunctive relief or other appropriate action in the name of the people of the township to enforce this section or an order issued pursuant to this section  1091996   7102002  res of 282017 sprinkling meter program a all water users within the township water supply system will be eligible to participate in the sprinkling meter program unless the township building department hereafter for purposes of this article only the department determines that participation in the program at a given premises would endanger the premises or the safe efficient functioning of the water supply system or any element thereof b any water user desiring to participate in the sprinkling meter program shall make written application to the township for the installation of the sprinkling meter if the department determines that the applicant is eligible then the applicant shall purchase a sprinkling meter from the ocwrc office the applicant shall also install any other appurtenances such as a cross connectionbackflow preventer that are required by the ocwrc office if the township board determines that the administration of the sprinkling meter program imposes costs upon the township then the township is authorized to set a fee for processing applications by resolution of the township board to defray such costs the function of such sprinkling meter shall be to measure the quantity of water used that is not discharged into the township sewer system all such meters shall be installed inside the premises all sprinkling meters shall be permanently plumbed into the water system of the premises as mandated by the ocwr commissioner no sprinkling meters shall be hooked to spigots or faucets in the event that sewer usage is billed or allocated according to usage as opposed to capacity then no premises shall have its sewer usage adjusted unless any sprinkling meter upon such premises is in compliance with this article the applicant shall contact the department in advance of the placement of a sprinkling meter to verify its location and compliance with these provisions c no water user participating in the sprinkling meter program shall cause or allow any water measured by the sprinkling meter to be discharged into the township sewer system any violation of this provision shall be a violation of this section  in addition to any other penalties set forth in this section or by law such violation shall subject the water user to any sewer usage charge for the entire water measured by the sprinkling meter since its initial installation and in addition a penalty of ten percent shall apply d meters and remote readers shall remain the property of the township or its designated agent and will at all times remain under its control and subject to the rules and regulations established from timetotime by the township water system ordinance e the owner of any premises where a meter is installed shall be held responsible for its care and protection from freezing or damage or interference by any person f all persons are forbidden to interfere with or move a water meter from any service connection without first receiving permission from the township no person shall remove or break any seal on meters or bypass valves g in the event a meter should fail it shall be the responsibility of the premises owner to have the meter repaired or replaced within 90 days in the event a meter has failed to operate the premises shall be billed at a rate equal to the greatest water use measurement of that meter taken over the preceding four quarterly billing periods h no determination of water usage made under the sprinkling meter program shall apply retroactively or entitle a water supply system user to a determination of usage prior to the connection of the sprinkling meter art 1 792008  art 1 5132009 with supplement 6 at the instruction of the township per an email of  article iii  sewers and sewage disposal division 1  generally definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning acceptable alternative graywater system means a system for the treatment and disposal of wastewater which normally does not receive human body wastes or industrial waste and is approved for use by the county health division acceptable innovative or alternative waste treatment system means a decentralized or individual waste system which has been approved for use by the county health division and which is properly operated and maintained so as not to cause a health hazard or nuisance an acceptable innovative or alternative waste treatment system may include but is not limited to an organic waste treatment system or compost toilet which operates on the principle of decomposition of heterogeneous organic materials by aerobic and facultatively anaerobic organisms and utilizes and effectively aerobic composting process which produces a stabilized humus acceptable innovative or alternative waste treatment system does not include a septic tankdrain field system or any other system which is determined by the state department of environmental quality to pose a similar threat to the public health safety and welfare and to the quality of surface and subsurface waters of this state area and district mean that portion of the township which is serviced by sanitary sewers or has available sanitary sewers for service or is to be served by sanitary sewers  this designation does not constitute a representation that the township will provide sanitary sewers in this area but rather that the township will encourage otherwise acceptable development to be serviced by sanitary sewers the area or district shall be adopted by resolution of the township board and is set forth in appendix a of this article asbuilt means engineering drawings prepared after installation of wastewater facilities which shall show a statement by a registered engineer or surveyor certifying the drawings to be asbuilt plans and shall include but not be limited to length of sewer invert elevation location with respect to property lines wye and riser locations and depths sewer material and joints used and mechanical electrical and structural details for pump stations wastewater treatment facilities and other appurtenances board and township board mean the township board of trustees connection charge means the amount charged at the time and in the amount as determined by resolution of the township board as provided in this article for connecting or being connected to the township sewer system or to a privately owned sewer system which in turn will be connected to the township sewer system and represents the proportionate cost allocable to the premises for the interceptor trunk laterals and treatment facilities by which sewage disposal services are provided the connection charge shall be set forth in appendix a of this article connector stub means a fixture attached to a sewer lateral as a means of extending the sewer system county drain commissioner and drain commissioner mean the successor to the board of public works of the county as the entity responsible for the operation and maintenance of the township sewer system pursuant to the terms of an operating agreement for the township extension of the clintonoakland sewage disposal system inspection fee means the amount charged to each applicant by the township to cover the cost of inspecting and approving the physical connection to the system and the issuance of a connection permit the inspection fee shall be set forth in appendix a of this article multiple family residence means any structure occupied as a residence by two or more single families living independently of each other where each family occupies a specific residence with separate cooking and lavatory facilities which residence is separated by a common wall or floor and whose sewer services are provided to the premises as one entity and charged for as one entity operating agreement means the agreement between the township and the county dated  whereby the county drain commissioner as a successor to the county board of public works has agreed to assume operations and maintenance responsibilities for the township extension of the clintonoakland sewage disposal system referred to generally in this article as the township sewer system sewer system or system premises means any dwelling building structure or place where human beings reside are employed or congregate and where such dwelling building or structure is in existence shall include the lot parcel or property upon which such dwelling building or structure stands and in the case of buildings containing partitioned units for human use such as apartments or stores within a shopping center building the term premises means that individual partitioned unit sanitary sewer means all conduits and appurtenances for the transmission of sewage from structures or premises sanitary sewer construction means the laying altering or repairing of sanitary sewers service lead means a pipe extending from the property line into premises for the purposes of removing sewage effluent sewage disposal lateral and lateral mean the township extensions of the clintonoakland sewage disposal system established under public act no 185 of 1957 mcl  as amended to be constructed by the county under a certain contract dated  between the county and the township together with all additions and laterals added to the sewer system constructed by the township or by private developers sewage disposal services means the collection transportation treatment and disposal of sanitary sewage emanating from premises now or hereafter in the area served by the sewage disposal laterals sewer system and system mean collectively all plants work properties and instrumentalities as they shall from time to time exist which are used or useful in connection with all sewer mains laterals and appurtenances thereto including specifically the township sewer system as described in the contracts between the county and the township structure means a single building with one connection to the sewer system even though more than one premises may be located within the structure unit means that measure of sanitary sewer disposal services equal to the quantity ordinarily required by occupants of a residence by a single family of average size and the number or fraction of units assigned to any premises or type of premises by the township board and adopting by reference the unit factor schedule prepared by the county drain commissioner is designated to represent the potential sanitary sewer services thereof and resulting benefit as a multiple of the quantity ordinarily required by occupants of a residence by a single family of average size as determined from time to time by the township board unit factor schedule means a schedule prepared and and determination of charges a connection charges in order to finance and meet the bond obligation of the township for the construction of the township sanitary sewer system including that portion of the system servicing any premises and in order to pay for sewer system construction and operating expenses there shall be a charge for any premises connected to the sewer system as provided in this division whether directly connected or indirectly connected privately owned sewer connection charge based upon the unit or fraction thereof by type of premises unit factor times the base connection charge which unit factor and base connection charge shall be established from time to time by resolution of the township board as set forth in appendix a of this article for a singlefamily residential premises connected to the sewer system where the lateral adjacent to the premises has been constructed and paid for solely by private sources on behalf of such premises the sewer connection charge shall equal the amount established by resolution of the township board as set forth in appendix a of this article the township shall also adopt by resolution a unit factor schedule which is set forth in appendix a of this article b usage charges there shall be a charge for the use of the sanitary sewer system for sewage disposal services which shall be an amount each quarter times the unit factor or fraction thereof assigned the premises which amount and unit factor shall be determined from time to time by resolution of the township board as is set forth in appendix a of this article c use of single meter for nonresidential premises nonresidential premises which are connected to a public water system may have sewer usage charges determined by the same water meter utilized to determine water usage charges relating to the public water system residential premises include singlefamily homes multiplefamily housing units and mobile homes the rate for metered sewer usage shall be in an amount as set forth in appendix a of this article d payment of sewer connection charges 1 new construction all new construction shall pay the sewer connection charge prior to obtaining the township building permit  provided however in order to facilitate the financing of new construction payment of the sewer connection charge may be made by paying not less than 50 percent of the charge as a condition to issuing the building permit not less than 25 percent of the charge as a condition to a rough plumbing inspection and the balance of 25 percent as a condition to the issuance of a certificate of occupancy 2 existing premises existing premises have the option of paying the sewer connection charge in cash or by making installment payments of all or part of the sewer connection charge over a period of five years together with interest upon any unpaid balance at an annual rate as determined by resolution of the township board from time to time for installment sewer connection charges as set forth in appendix a of this article all payments will be first applied against interest and the balance of the payments applied against principal the sewer connection installment charges will be set forth as part of the quarterly sewer bill all or part of the sewer connection charge may be paid off without penalty this provision is intended to allow existing premises to extend their payments for a maximum period of five years in order to provide sanitary sewers to all regardless of economic status e deferred payment of connection charge for elderly and disabled an owner of any premises against which a sewer connection charge has been levied who is 65 years of age or older or who is totally and permanently disabled a citizen of the us a resident of this state for five or more years and the sole owner of such premises for five or more years is eligible for the deferment of payment of the lateral benefit charge under state law application for this deferred payment is to be made in accordance with state law being public act no 225 of 1976 mcl  et seq this provision shall not be more restrictive than is allowed by state law as it may be amended from time to time f determination of unit factor for new construction for premises to be newly constructed the township building inspector shall assign the appropriate unit factor to determine the amount of the new premises connection charge and usage charge 1 written notice from building inspector for premises other than singlefamily homes the building inspector shall provide the premises owner or other responsible person a written notice of the unit factor assignment identifying the type or use of the premises and the corresponding unit factor assignment the notice shall also inform the owner or responsible party that the party has 30 days following the date of the notice to review the unit factor determination with the building inspector and further notice that should the determination remain unchanged following the meeting with the building inspector the owner or responsible party has an additional ten days after the date of the written confirmation of the determination to file with the township clerk a request for review of this determination by the townships water and sewer committee 2 meeting the building inspector shall if requested provide an opportunity for the owner or responsible party to be heard on objections to the determination within 30 days of the date of the notice after review with the owner or responsible party the building inspector shall forthwith provide a written confirmation of the unit factor determination to the owner 3 township water and sewer committee review the owner if aggrieved by such determination may within ten days of the building inspectors written confirmation file with the township clerk a written request for review by township water and sewer committee if no request is made to the township clerk within the tenday period the building inspectors determination shall become final the township water and sewer committee shall thereafter review a timely request to review the building inspectors determination within 45 days of the filing of the request to review and shall have the authority to modify in whole or in part the determination made by the building inspector the decision of the township water and sewer committee shall be final and shall be furnished to the premises owner or other responsible person in writing by the township clerk g change in premises use if the use of a premises is changed after the time the premises initial connection charge andor usage charges are determined and assessed the township shall adjust the connection charge andor usage charge pursuant to the unit factor schedule to reflect the amended use of the premises 1 for usage charges the amended unit factor rate shall be adjusted for the quarterly billing date one full quarterly billing period after the township has been alerted of the change 2 for a connection charge if the unit factor is adjusted higher than the original unit factor utilized to determine the initial connection charge and the premises has paid the initial connection charge in full the premises shall pay the difference between the initial connection charge and the adjusted connection charge based on the change in unit factor in addition if the unit factor is increased above the amount of the adjusted connection charge the premises shall likewise pay the difference between a prior adjusted connection charge and the new higher adjusted connection charge 3 if a structure that has a single connection to the sewer system contains multiple premises a change in a unit factor triggering an adjustment in a usage charge andor connection charge under this section shall be determined based upon a change to the aggregate unit factor of the whole structure h notice of increase in unit factor in the event of a determination by the township that an increase in the unit factor for any given premises as set forth above required due to an increased use capacity the township building inspector shall prepare and forward by mail to the owner or responsible party of the premises a notice of the increased unit factor the notice shall contain the following 1 the present unit factor assignment based on existing or previous usage 2 a statement setting forth the nature of the increased use capacity necessitating a unit factor adjustment 3 a statement of the proposed increased unit factor assignment for the premises based upon the increased use capacity and a description as to how the unit factor increase will result in an adjustment of connection charges and usage charges 4 a statement that the increased unit factor assignment shall become effective with resulting changes to connection charges and usage charges prior to the time a new certificate of occupancy will be granted for the change in use and that the new certificate of occupancy will not be granted until the additional connection charges are paid 5 notice to the owner or responsible party that if the amounts due are delinquent for more than six months the amount shall be added to the tax rolls and collected pursuant to the general property tax laws 6 notice to the owner or responsible party that the party has 30 days following the date of the notice to review the increased unit factor determination with the building inspector and further notice that should the determination remain unchanged following the meeting with the building inspector whereby the building inspector confirms the determination in writing the owner or responsible party has an additional ten days after the date of the written confirmation of the determination to file with the township clerk a request for review of this determination by the townships water and sewer committee i building inspector to hear objections to determinations the building inspector shall if requested provide an opportunity for the owner or responsible party to be heard on objections to the determination within 30 days of the date of the notice after review with the owner or responsible party the building inspector shall forthwith provide a written confirmation of the determination of increase to the owner and to the township water and sewer committee the owner if aggrieved by such determination shall have an additional ten days thereafter to file with the township clerk a written request for review by the township water and sewer committee if no request is filed within the time allowed the building inspectors determination shall become final j township water and sewer committee review from the time of filing of a request for review with the clerk the township water and sewer committee shall thereafter within 45 days review the building inspectors determination and shall have the authority to modify in whole or in part the determination the decision of the township water and sewer committee shall be final and shall be furnished to the building inspector and premises owner or other responsible party in writing by the township clerk k delinquent charges all delinquent service fees a prospective reduction 1 any premises utilized for a purpose other than a singlefamily home using the sewer system and paying quarterly service fees based on a unit factor greater than one pursuant to section 62111b shall be entitled upon a timely and proper request to a reduction in sewer usage charges to a unit factor of one provided the premises shall be unoccupied and the sewer system unused for a period of at least 90 days 2 if any premises will be unoccupied and the sewer system unused for a period of 90 days or more and the premises owner desires a reduction in sewer fees it is the responsibility of the premises owner or person responsible for the payment of the usage charges to inform the township of the prospective period when the premises will be unoccupied and the sewer system unused 3 once the township is informed the premises will be unoccupied and the sewer system unused for a period of at least 90 days beginning on the due date of the next quarterly sewer service payment the usage charge for that quarter and for any prospective quarter or quarters when the premises remains unoccupied and the sewer system unused shall be reduced to a unit factor of one 4 if the premises should become occupied during such a quarter or should the sewer system be used it is the responsibility of the premises owner or person responsible for payment of the sewer usage charge to inform the township immediately of the change the sewer usage rate charged before the reduction shall then resume from the date when the property is reoccupied or the sewer system used the quarterly usage charge will be reinstated on a prorata basis for the portion of the quarter that the property is reoccupied and the sewer system is used 5 failure to inform the township of reoccupancy of the premises shall be considered a violation of this article the township shall have the authority to recover the amount of sewer usage charges and all costs and actual professional fees incurred including attorney fees expended in order to determine compliance with and to enforce the requirements of this article the township shall also have the authority to execute a lien against the property upon which the premises are located equal to the amount of unrecovered sewer usage charges and all enforcement costs and fees b retroactive reduction 1 any premises utilized for a purpose other than a singlefamily home using the sewer system and paying quarterly usage charges based on a unit factor greater than one pursuant to section 62111b shall be entitled upon a timely and property request to a of the sewer usage fee shall provide sufficient substantial evidence corroborating the claim the premises were unoccupied and the sewer system unused 3 after the effective date of the ordinance from which this article is derived any premises owner or person responsible for payment of the sewer service fee seeking a credit against future sewer usage charges for any 90day period when the premises have been unoccupied and the sewer system unused after the enactment of the ordinance from which this article is derived must apply for the credit within one year of the date when the premises were last unoccupied and the sewer system unused in order to qualify for a credit the owner or other person must show sufficient good cause why he failed to provide the township with advance notice pursuant to this subsection b of this section and must provide sufficient evidence to corroborate a claim the premises were unoccupied and the sewer system unused 4 in no event however shall the if such a violation should occur art viii 1122005 hardship deferments of lateral benefit charges and capital charges a eligibility 1 a property owner shall not be considered to have a hardship under under this section the value of life insurance shall be computed at the cash surrender value available and payable upon demand and only that portion of the value thereof which is in excess of $100000 footnotes  2  editors note adopted feb 28 200 amended art iv in its entirety to read as herein set out former art iv  6215162163 pertained to similar subject matter and derived from arts 113 adopted mar 27 2002 division 1  generally delegation of authority the city of detroit detroit water and sewerage department as the state approved control authority is authorized to administer and enforce the provisions of this article on behalf of the township the township has executed and hereby ratifies its delegation agreement with the city of detroit detroit water and sewerage department which sets forth the terms and conditions of such delegated authority consistent with this article and shall allow the detroit water and sewerage department to perform the specific responsibilities of control authority pursuant to state and federal law art 1 2282007 purpose a the purpose of this article is the protection of the environment and of public health and safety by abating and preventing pollution regulation and control of the quantity and quality of wastes admitted to or discharged into the wastewater collection and treatment system under the jurisdiction of the township and enabling the township to comply with all applicable state and federal laws required by the federal water pollution control act being 33 usc  125 et seq and the general pretreatment regulations being 40 cfr part 403 b the objectives of this article are 1 to prevent the introduction of pollutants into the wastewater system which will interfere with the operation of the system or contaminate the resulting sludge or will pose a hazard to the health or welfare of the people or of employees of the city of detroit water and sewerage department  2 to prevent the introduction of pollutants into the wastewater system which will pass inadequately treated system into receiving waters the atmosphere or the environment or otherwise be incompatible with the system  3 to improve the opportunity to recycle or reclaim wastewater or sludge from the system in an economical and advantageous manner  and 4 to provide for the recovery of the costs from users of the wastewater collection and treatment system sufficient to administer regulatory activities and meet the costs of the operation maintenance improvement or replacement of the system 5 this article provides for the regulation of contributors to the detroit and township wastewater collection and treatment system issuance of wastewater discharge permits to certain users and enforcement of general requirements for all users authorizes monitoring and enforcement and authorizes fees and penalties art 2 2282007 authority by virtue of the obligations and authority placed upon the township by the federal water pollution control act also known as the clean water act as amended being 33 usc  1251 et seq  the 1963 constitution of the state of michigan  public act 245 of 192 as amended being mcl 3231 et seq  msa  et seq  the township charter  the national pollutant discharge elimination system npdes permit for the city of detroit publicly owned treatment works potw  the consent judgment in us epa v city of detroit et al federal district court for the eastern district of michigan case no 771100 as amended  and existing or future contracts between the board of water commissioners and suburban communities or other governmental or private entities  or by virtue of common law usage of the system this article shall apply to every user contributing or causing to be contributed or discharging pollutants or wastewater into the wastewater collection and treatment system of the city of detroit potw art 3 2282007 definitions a for purposes of this article and unless the context specifically indicates 6215662160  reserved division 2  discharge prohibitions general pollutant prohibitions no user shall discharge or cause to be discharged into the potw directly or indirectly any pollutant or wastewater which will cause interference or pass general discharge prohibitions shall apply to all users of the potw whether or not the user is subject to national categorical pretreatment standards or to any other federal state or local pretreatment standards or requirements in addition it shall be unlawful for a user to discharge into the potw 1 any liquid solid or gas which by reason of its nature or quantity is sufficient either alone or by interaction with other substances to create a fire or explosion hazard or to be injurious in any other way to persons to the potw or to the operations of the potw pollutants which create a fire or explosion hazard in a potw include but are not limited to wastestreams with a closed cup flash point of less than 140 degrees fahrenheit or 60 degrees celsius using the test methods specified in 40 cfr  26121  or 2 any solid or viscous substance in concentrations or quantities which are sufficient to cause obstruction to the flow in a sewer or other encumbrances to the operation of the potw including but not limited to grease animal guts or tissues bones hair hides or fleshing entrails whole blood feathers ashes cinders sand cement spent lime stone or marble dust metal glass straw shavings grass clippings rags strings fibers spent grains spent hops wastepaper wood plastic tar asphalt residues residues from refining or processing of fuel or lubrication oil mud or glass grinding or polishing wastes or tumbling and deburring stones  or 3 any wastewater having a ph of less than 50 units or greater than 115 units  or 4 any wastewater containing petroleum oil nonbiodegradable cutting oil products of mineral oil origin or toxic pollutants in sufficient concentration or quantity either singly or by interaction with other pollutants to cause interference or pass or constitute a hazard to humans or animals  or 5 any liquid gas solid or form of energy which either singly or by interaction with other waste is sufficient to create toxic gas vapor or fume within the potw in quantities that may cause acute worker health and safety problems or may cause a public nuisance or hazard to life or are sufficient to prevent entry into the sewers for their maintenance and repair  or 6 any substance which is sufficient to cause the potws effluent or any other product of the potw such as residue sludge or scum to be unsuitable for reclamation processing where the potw is pursuing a reuse and reclamation program in no case shall a substance discharged to the potw cause the potw to be in noncompliance with sludge use or disposal criteria guidelines or regulations developed under 33 usc  134 with any criteria guidelines or developed and promulgated regulations affecting sludge use or disposal developed pursuant to the solid waste disposal act the federal clean air act the federal toxic substances control act or with state criteria applicable to the sludge management method being used  or 7 any substance which will cause the potw to violate either the consent judgment in us epa v city of detroit et al federal district court for the eastern district of michigan case no 771100 or the city of detroits national pollutant discharge elimination system permit  or 8 any discharge having a color uncharacteristic of the wastewater being discharged  or 9 any wastewater having a temperature which will inhibit biological activity in the potw treatment plant resulting in interference but in no case wastewater with a temperature at the introduction into a public sewer which exceeds 150 degrees fahrenheit or which will cause the influent at the wastewater treatment plant to rise above 104 degrees fahrenheit 40 degrees celsius  or 10 any pollutant discharge which constitutes a slug  or 11 any wastewater containing any radioactive wastes or isotopes of such halflife or concentration as may exceed limits established in compliance with applicable federal or state regulations  or 12 any floating fats oil or grease which are sufficient to cause interference with or pass potw  or 13 any solid materials having a specific gravity greater than 12 or a cross section dimension of onehalf inch or greater which are processes and which are clearly labeled as confidential shall not be made available for inspection by the public but shall be made available upon request to governmental agencies for uses related to operated in conformance with this subsection  9 6151962 noise a subject to subsection b of this section a person shall not operate a motorboat on navigable waters unless the motorboat is equipped and maintained with an effective muffler or underwater exhaust system that does not produce sound levels in excess of 90 dba when subjected to a stationary sound level test as prescribed by sae j2005 or a sound level in excess of 75 dba when subjected to a shoreline sound level measurement procedure as described by sae j1970 the operator of a motorboat shall present the motorboat for a sound level test as prescribed by sae j2005 upon the request of a peace officer if a motorboat is equipped with more than one motor or engine the test shall be performed with all motors or engines operating to determine whether a person is violating this subsection a peace officer may measure sound levels pursuant to procedures prescribed in sae j1970 issued 199192 b if the state has established by rule a motorboat sound level test and set a maximum decibel level permitted for motorboat operation that replace the tests and maximum decibel levels permitted under subsection a of this section all of the following apply 1 a person shall not operate a motorboat on navigable waters if the motorboat produces sound levels that exceed the maximum decibel level established under this subsection 2 the operator of a motorboat shall present the motorboat for the sound level test established pursuant to this subsection upon the request of a peace officer 3 a motorboat equipped with more than one motor or engine shall be tested with all motors or engines operating c a person shall not manufacture sell or offer for sale a motorboat for use on the waters of this state unless that motorboat is equipped and maintained with an effective muffler or underwater exhaust system that complies with the applicable sound levels permitted under subsection a or b of this section d subsections a and b of this section do not apply to any of the following 1 a motorboat tuning up or testing for or participating in official trials for speed records or a sanctioned race conducted pursuant to a permit issued by an appropriate unit of government 2 a motorboat being operated by a boat or marine engine manufacturer for the purpose of testing or development 3 a motorboat that qualifies as an historic vessel as defined by state law e as used in this section the term dba means decibels on the a scale on a sound meter having characteristics of a general purpose sound meter as defined by american national standards institute s141983 f a person who violates this section is guilty of a misdemeanor punishable by imprisonment for not more than 90 days and a fine of not less than $10000 or more than $50000 additionally before putting the motorboat back in use a person who violates this section is required to install an effective muffler or underwater exhaust system that meets the requirements of this section on the motorboat in violation at his expense  11 6151962 appendix a  franchises footnotes  1  cross reference businesses ch 14  environment ch 22  electric and gas supply franchises  4231 et charter township of oxford oakland county michigan ordains footnotes  2  editors note printed in this article is as adopted on  amendments are indicated by parenthetical history notes following amended provisions the absence of a history note indicates that the provision remains unchanged from the original obvious misspellings and punctuation errors have been corrected without notation for stylistic purposes headings and catchlines have been made uniform and the same system of capitalization citation to state statutes and expression of numbers in text as appears in the ordinances has been used additions made for clarity are indicated by brackets grant term the charter township of oxford oakland county michigan hereby grants to the consumers power company a michigan corporation its successors and assigns hereinafter called the grantee the right power and authority to lay maintain and operate gas mains pipes and services on along across and under the highways streets alleys bridges and other public places and to do a local gas business in the charter township of oxford oakland county michigan consideration in consideration of the rights power and authority hereby granted said grantee shall faithfully perform all things required by the terms hereof conditions no highway street alley bridge or other public place used by said grantee shall be obstructed longer than necessary during the work of construction or repair and shall be restored to the same order and condition as when said work was commenced all of grantees pipes and mains shall be so placed in the highways and other public places as not to unnecessarily interfere with the use thereof for highway purposes hold harmless said grantee shall at all times keep and save the charter township free and harmless from all loss costs and expense to which it may be subject by reason of the negligent construction and maintenance of the structures and equipment hereby authorized in case any action is commenced against the charter township upon account of the permission herein given said grantee shall upon notice defend the township and save it free and harmless from all loss cost and damage arising out of such negligent construction and maintenance extensions said grantee shall construct and extend its gas distribution system within said charter township and shall furnish gas to applicants residing therein in accordance with applicable laws rules and regulations franchise not exclusive the rights power and authority herein granted are not exclusive either manufactured or natural gas may be furnished hereunder rates said grantee shall be entitled to charge the inhabitants of said charter township of oxford for gas furnished therein the rates as approved by the michigan public service commission to which commission or its successors authority and jurisdiction to fix and regulate gas rates and rules regulating such service in said charter township are hereby granted for the term of this franchise such rates and rules shall be subject to review and change at any time upon petition therefor being made by either said charter township acting by its township board or by said grantee revocation the franchise granted by this ordinance is subject to revocation upon 60 days written notice by the party desiring such revocation michigan public service commission jurisdiction said grantee shall as to all other conditions and elements of service not herein fixed be and remain subject to the reasonable rules and regulations of the michigan public service commission or its successors applicable to gas service in said charter township repealer this ordinance when accepted and published as herein provided shall repeal and supersede the provisions of the ordinance adopted on  entitled an ordinance granting to consumers power company its successors and assigns the right power and authority to lay maintain and operate gas mains pipes and services on along across and under the highways streets alleys bridges and other public places and to do a local gas business in the township of oxford oakland county michigan for a period of 30 years and amendments if any to such ordinance whereby a gas franchise was granted to consumers power company effective date this ordinance shall take effect upon the day after the date of publication thereof provided however it shall cease and by be of no effect after 30 days from its adoption unless within said period the grantee shall accept the same in writing filed with the township clerk upon acceptance and publication hereof this ordinance shall constitute a contract between said charter township and said grantee we hereby certify that the foregoing ordinance was duly enacted by the charter township of oxford 11 zoning effective  article 1 title purpose enabling authority and conditions of enactment 11 title this be known and may be cited as the charter township of oxford zoning 2 purpose the purpose of this to provide in oxford charter township for the establishment of districts which regulate the use of land and structures a to meet the needs of the states citizens for food fiber energy and other natural resources places of residence recreation industry trade service and other uses of land  b to insure that use of the land shall be situated in appropriate locations and relationships  c to limit the inappropriate overcrowding of land and congestion of population transportation systems and other public facilities  d to facilitate adequate and efficient provision for transportation systems sewage disposal water energy education recreation and other public service and facility requirements  e and to promote public health safety and welfare for these purposes the board by this the township into districts of such number shape and area as it considers best suited to carry out the act by which this authorized and to achieve specific land management objectives and avert or solve specific land use problems including the regulation of growth and development and the establishment of districts in areas subject to damage from flooding or erosion this land development is also adopted for designating or limiting the location height number of stories and size of dwellings buildings and structures that may be erected or altered and the specific uses of such dwellings buildings and structures  and the maximum number of families which may be housed in buildings dwellings and structures erected or altered the provisions of this intended to be uniform for each class of land or buildings dwellings and structure throughout each district but the provisions in one district may differ from those in other districts the board does not regulate nor control the drilling completion or operation of oil or gas wells or other wells drilled for oil or gas exploration purposes and shall not have jurisdiction with reference to the issuance of permits for the location drilling completion operation or abandonment of those wells charter township of oxford 12 zoning effective  13 enabling authority this adopted pursuant to the michigan zoning enabling act act as if said act as amended at this time or may be amended in the future were repeated wordforword herein 14 scope and construction of regulations a this be liberally construed in such manner as to best implement its purpose in interpreting and applying the provisions of this the requirements shall be held to be the minimum for the promotion of the public health safety convenience comfort prosperity and general welfare b no building or structure or part thereof shall hereafter be erected constructed reconstructed or altered and no new use or change shall be made of any building structure or land or part thereof except as permitted by the provisions of this where a condition imposed by a provision of this the use of any lot building or structure is conflicting with a condition imposed by any other provision of this or by the provision of an ordinance adopted under any other law the provision which is more restrictive shall govern d nothing within this be construed to prevent compliance with an order by the appropriate authority to correct improve strengthen or restore to a safe or healthy condition any part of a building or premises declared unsafe or unhealthy 15 relationship to other ordinances regulations or agreements this not intended to abrogate or annul any ordinance rule regulation permit easement covenant or other private agreement previously adopted issued or entered easements covenants or other private agreements the requirements of this govern 16 vested right nothing in this be interpreted or construed to give rise to any permanent vested right in the not discretionary the word may is permissive e all measurements shall be to the nearest integer unless otherwise specified herein f the phrase used for includes arranged for designed for intended for occupied for and maintained for g the word building includes the word structure the word build includes the words erect and construct a building or structure includes any part thereof h the word
